description:
Every time I go here it's a good time. They make a killer rare burger and killer fries. They also have Racer 5 IPA on tap. That's pretty cool not to use a bartender, just have the server do it. Good idea. 

Also a fan of multi-level places. Offers more room, and constricted spaces aren't fun. 

A burger anywhere might be mediocre, but not at Super Duper Burger. Not only are they pretty quick at serving, you can taste the meat. 

This is one of my favorite places to get some grub. Shout out for the innovation and keeping me coming back for more. 

Also one time was so good just had to order another burger. Happiness is on steroids here. Ha.
author: Mike H.

description:
Review for ice cream.  After a good lunch at a nearby ramen joint where the meal was too salty, I wanted ice cream and went into Super Duper.  They had a sign outside that that serve ice cream swirl. 

The child size was more than enough. I shared with Hubby. It was mix of choc and vanilla on a cone. Hubby liked the chocolate flavor. The swirl was OK and very generous for $3. The adult version was $5 and 5 swirls she told me. It started to melt quickly such that I could only imagine what a mess it would be if I got the adult cone instead. And it wasn't even a hot day outside. 

Not sure I'd get the ice cream again but I think I'd pop in to try the burgers next time.
author: Ry T.

description:
Popped by for a quick bite while running around the city. Nice, spacious interior with multiple levels. Great wall art. We beat the crowd, but not by much. There was a line out the door while we waited on our food.

We got the Mini Burger -- one patty only -- for $5.75. We also added cheese, which was an additional 50 cents. Nice and juicy, great flavor. Quite pricey, though, considering it wasn't even a combo. No fries or drink.

We also got a Cookies & Cream Super Shake for $5.75. This was SO delicious, we finished it in minutes. So creamy and rich and sweet. Decent size, too. I would absolutely recommend their Super Shakes over the Regular Shakes. Too bad there's just one size.

If you opt for to-go, expect a surcharge of 10 cents on your bill that's labeled under "SF Bag Ordinance."

I will be back for those shakes! And maybe some garlic fries?
author: Kathy Z.

description:
1st time here. Never heard of this place. The service was very friendly. I had their chicken sandwich. It was very tasty, alot of flavor going on in their sauce. Chicken was cooked perfect, juicy , not dry.

The only negative thing was the cigarette smoke blowing in to the upstairs seating area. Not sure if it was coming from the back patio or from in front of restaurant since all the doors are open. I hate cigarette smoke, kinda blew my meal i was enjoying.
author: Mike W.

description:
This place might be my new favorite fast casual hamburger restaurant. It was multiple stories tall. I chose to sit on the second floor and enjoy a nice view of the city. 
The menu there is simple, however there are plenty of options if you want to get creative. I ordered a double cheeseburger with lettuce lettuce caramelize onions and cheese. The burger juicy and came out a perfectly cooked medium. The hamburger bun had a sweetness to it that I hadn't tasted before. It was almost reminiscent of a Hawaiian roll. Everybody working there was very happy and helpful.
author: Christian D.

description:
No complaints about the burgers and service, however, how can one give a positive review when this Super Duper location continues to use the worst deliver service, which in turn uses the worst delivery people... Postmates!
To continue to provide your customers with the same great food and service you do so at all your sites, you must sever your ties with Postmates as they're making you look not so super. Otherwise, you're only as good, or rather just as bad, as the people you choose to work with!
author: Foofa B.

description:
Still not sold on hamburgers, but this place is pretty good for a hamburger-disliker like me.

I got the mini burger with portabello mushrooms, egg, avocado, and bacon. I guess I'm a bit of a food purist in that I prefer to taste the individual items instead of blending them all together. The portabello mushrooms were nice and meaty and the bacon on its own was alright. The meat was crispy on the outside on soft on the inside. That egg they made was perfectly golden yoke. The buns are sweet, soft, and fresh.

Those garlic fries are pretty good as well. Very reminiscent of being at a fair. 

My coworkers swear by their milkshakes and soft serve. I had the chocolate dipped cone once and it was really tasty! A perfect summer treat.

3.75 stars for me, but definitely higher for burger luvaaas.

--
Edit: I finally checked out those famed shakes yesterday, specifically the strawberries and cream. It felt like McDonald's shakes of yester-year, with real cream and strawberries. Not overwhelmingly sweet either, which was perfect.
author: Nicole H.

description:
If the food was as good as the branding they'd have a spot worth visiting.

But just no.
author: Noodly J.

description:
I'm not into meat much these days, but when WOM from a person of high caliber in the food and wine industry speaks volumes of this Bay Area burger group, I gotta check the hype.  

My first meal at SDB was a super duper heavy one- A Super Duper Burger with cheese, garlic fries, and a chocolate shake.  Yes, I hated myself after this meal and took a long walk uphill on California St. and around the block a couple of times before heading back to work.  However, I understand and respect the hype.  The cheeseburger was super duper fresh and juicy, the shake is large and filling enough to make a meal on its own, super duper chocolatey, and the garlic fries, although deliciously crisp and cheesy, HOLY MOTHER, is super duper garlicky to give someone super duper stank breath for days.  Next time, I shall ask for light garlic.  

So, there is a next time in the future? Of course!  In fact, I brought my children here for the first time yesterday.  My 8-year-old son said, "I love this burger, it tastes like short ribs!"- His favorite food of all time.  I plan to come back for the veggie burgers next time.  Maybe the shake for another time.
author: Leslie G.

description: Typical fast food burger with fries. Overly greasy which is obvious for fast food joint but too much did my liking. But get was good but fries were basic.
author: Moji O.

description:
This place is surprisingl big inside so we found a place to sit downstairs next to the foosball and other games they have set out.  
Food was delicious, cheeseburger, garlic fries and chocolate shake.  Folks are friendly at the front counter.
author: Steve T.

description: LOVEE SUPER DUPER gourmet food at a reasonable price and great customer service I love everything on there menu especially the chicken sandwich and I cant get enough of there fresh made doughnuts they have it all
author: Tessa G.

description: Another review said "believe the hype" and I would say let's hype it up even more. The burger was so moist, fresh and delicious! The mini is really filling and the garlic fries are in fact very garlic intense while still maintaining the integrity of the flavor of the fries. The doughnuts are fresh and crispy. They taste so good and you can get 3 for $2 which is a steal. The location here is not one of the more highly populated ones which makes it nice and the location is spacious and comfortable. This restaurant was one of the only places open on Memorial Day and we were way to early for happy hour which I recommend because it seems like it's one of the better happy hours I've seen. From 4pm to close you can get $15 pitchers $5 beers and free fries with the purchase of beer or wine. They also have Jenga and a foosball table!
author: Susie E.

description: The best fast food burger I've had- hands down!  And the donuts are phenomenal as well. This place makes In and Out look like McDonalds.
author: Susie B.

description: Really small place but the burgers are really good! I had a chicken sandwich and it was so juicy and flavorful! The fries are very crispy but not burnt. Sooo yummy!
author: Nicole A.

description:
At this location they serve breakfast until 2pm.

Sausage egg and cheese breakfast sandwich: looks almost exactly like McDonalds' sausage McMuffin but doesn't taste as good. Stick with the burgers.

Hash brown: average hash browns, not as good as McDonald's 

Super duper burger: very juicy and they always crisp the edges

Garlic fries: made with fresh garlic and 6 months aged cheese, delicious

All the ingredients here are natural (even the catsup) so the burgers and fries taste really good.
author: Tom P.

description:
Have been here a few times- when I used to eat meat and now since I am pescatarian. Came back because I knew they had a veggie burger option.

Ambiance: Pretty big inside considering it being downtown SF. They have a little seating upstairs and a lot downstairs. Looks like a burger spot!

Service: You stand in line and order and then get a buzzer to know when your food is ready. The employees behind the counter are always nice. If you get lucky, when they have leftover donuts from the morning- they hand them out free with your lunch. 

Food: I LOVE their veggie burger!!! I don't get the veggie burger on the menu with hummus though- I've tried it and didn't like it that much. I get a veggie patty with the normal toppings on it- so bomb! I usually get a side of regular fries too- I've tried the garlic ones and they are just too gnarly for me (especially for lunch). Not sure what's in the veggie burger but it's super duper good! ;) 

Great spot for meat eaters or vegetarians!
author: Hayley D.

description:
This place was surprisingly good, especially for a fast food place! They take a while to cook the meal, but the result was excellent and I was quite amazed at the quality. That being said, the food was a little on the pricey for what it was, at about $5.50 for a one patty burger, and like $7.75 for a two patty burger. When you order they hand you one of those round circle things and it beeps when your food is ready (they are slower than most fast food places).

The burger was excellent though, especially the patty. It was seared nice and well on the outside, having an almost crispy outer layer, but it was nice and juicy on the inside. The sauce was pretty good too, not too overpowering, it was like a light thousand island sauce with a bit more sour.

Overall I was quite impressed, and will probably be back to try more. For the price category and fast food status, this is one of the better burgers I have had.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I kept hearing about Super Duper Burger's, so I had to try it.

We were greeted quickly and placed our order. We got a pager and waited for the buzzer to go off.

The food itself was fresh, smelled great and came in a good portion. The garlic fries were delicious. The meat was tender, the bread was fresh and overall filling. The ranch needs some help, I am not sure if that was homemade but it sure did taste like Kraft. They need some buttermilk in it.  =)

I like the option of adding all the free toppings. I wish the cashier would have told me that the Jalapenos were extra spicy! But I still enjoyed them.

The price is what really made me want to eat here. Everything in SF is overpriced and it's great that this place offers a great meal for a reasonable price.  A burger by itself will run you about $8, if you're feeling greedy get you some fries and a drink and you'll be set for $15. If your feeling not so greedy get a salad or a mini burger.

The restroom conditions were no Bueno. I had to wash my hands and it did not smell great. They are unisex so maybe one gender is cleaner than the other, I will not point fingers.

I would come back here. Next time I am checking out their breakfast menu. I hope they can make me a cheese and egg sandwich!
author: Kam H.

description: Mini burger with avocado add on was a wonderful combination. The beef patty was tender and juicy. The veggie in the burger was fresh. The fries were not too oily. I love the cookie and cream milkshake! The restaurant was very spacious and easy to find a table.
author: Laien X.

description: This place was amazing! the staff were friendly, attentive, and extremely helpful. The burger was hand down the best burger I have ever eaten in my life and the garlic cheddar fries are to die for. I strongly recommend this joint if your looking for that all american burger.
author: Zachary L.

description: Just can't go wrong here. Never had a bad experience! Always prompt service with a smile, decent prices, fresh ingredients and best of all, beer to wash it all down with (got you beat there, in-n-out) and ALL THE FREE PICKLES!
author: Theresa C.

description: Great place for a veggie burger. (Order on focaccia bread to avoid eggs.) The person taking orders was very helpful and friendly and the restaurant is clean and well stocked. The burger tasted fresh and wasn't dry. The fries were also yummy and were a very generous potion. Don't skip the condiments! The ketchup, mustard and pickles are something special.
author: Molly C.

description:
If this was an AirBnb, I would pay up to $240 to stay in it.

If there was a cardboard box in front of this place, I would sleep in it one night for the free burger smells. 

If their garlic fries were a man...well..I really liked the garlic fries ok?

Clean, urban contemporary, serves beer and wine, has killer burgers. Order at the front, seat yourself. Has an elevator to go down to more seating. It's true about the kids, there was a gang of them playing foosball. I actually didn't expect to see that while walking downstairs with my glass of wine lol. Get free fries when you buy a drink during their happy hour. They also do the soft serve ice cream thing, organic Strauss, where it's like totally amazing how much ice cream they can pile onto a sugar cone...(3 bucks I wanna say?)

Why do I Yelp at 3am in bed in the dark? Because I'm hungry and want to torture myself with memories of Super Duper Burger.
author: Annie M.

description:
These burgers are good!  They're not kidding when they say their burgers are juicy. I recommend eating inside this establishment because the juices on these bad boys will flow.  Their house pickles are also excellent.  I have yet to try their shakes but I will the next time I stop by.
The prices are a bit on the high side for a burger, drink and fries, but I guess that's the price you pay for lunch in the city... :-/
author: I Will A.

description: The name says it all!!! The burgers were super duper delicious! Veryyyy busy place in union square during lunch hours. Food was quick to get out even with the line out the door. The atmosphere would be modern decor kinda industrial. The inside is kinda echoey with everyone's conversation in a small area. Just behind this place is a beautiful park where we enjoyed our lunch. I'd definitely recommend this place.
author: Amanda C.

description: Ate here yesterday afternoon - got food poisoning. STEER CLEAR. Been on the bed for 24 hours.
author: Rajeev B.

description:
Breakfast sandwich is mediocre. One egg, cheese and choice of meat in an English muffin is nothing to get excited about because it just isn't that good. Hash brown is only $.75. Looks and tastes like a frozen hash brown sold at any supermarket.

I probably won't be back but I think it serves its purpose. Pretty quick breakfast that's affordable.
author: Stephanie C.

description: My only complaint is that the Burger patty meat is the way to Greasy!  I love the taste beef andI was hoping to taste beef but instead I felt like I was eating oil and grease. Other than the greasy meat the place is really beautiful very clean the garlic fries were delicious. The veggies are fresh and their homemade pickles are delicious too. The staff were really nice.
author: Diana H.

description:
I have eaten at super duper many times over the past 5 years. It's going down hill quickly as they keep adding more locations and loosing sight of quality. It is easy to tell there is no where near the same quality of cooking, preparation or attention to detail.  They might be using the same high quality ingredient but the execution in the kitchen shows that there is poor training and management from the upper level cooks who should be focused on quality control. 

You're much better off going to one of the many other high end burger places or In-N-Out.
author: Douglas P.

description:
Now that Super Duper is a known quantity and a well established chain in this city, it doesn't seem to make sense to review these places individually anymore, do you think? I really don't see a huge variation in the quality of the burger or the fries, though I don't mean that necessarily as a compliment. After all, McDonald's doesn't display any variation in the burgers at their various locations either, even with their so-called custom line of burgers. In fact, you count on them to present the exact same burger, and I think Super Duper has managed that feat at their locations, the Kearny Street location not being an exception. I went for the $12 Super Combo, which allowed me a $7.75 Super Burger.

The so-called deal included a double patty burger slathered in their super sauce (whatever that is) plus an extra 75-cents for cheese, an order of fries that would have cost $2.75, and a $2.25 fountain drink (photo: http://bit.ly/2fiHIsJ). So I saved a whopping 75-cents by ordering the combo, not an insignificant amount as I prepare for an economic depression induced by Trump's trickle-down idiocy. So did it meet my expectations? Pretty much with the burger juicy though a tad too greasy to be fully enjoyable. What disappointed was the service which was curt and abrupt. We went downstairs where all the seating was. Rambunctious teens had taken over. Get off my lawn...and leave my Jenga masterpiece alone!

FOOD - 3 stars...a super burger but not a Super Burger if you know what I mean
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...space downstairs in the kids' room
SERVICE - 1.5 stars...not very nice here
TOTAL - 2 stars...alas, if it was only about the burger
author: Ed U.

description:
This place is so good!!! Came here not really knowing what to expect but left with full hearts and full stomaches. Ordered the classic hamburger with fries -- the hamburger surprisingly had 2 beef patties and was only around $7 (so budget-friendly for SF!!). The fries were all right but wow the burger was dee-lish!! The restaurant itself is also really cute, with a cute little patio at the back.

Definitely will come back!!
author: Ella C.

description: I ordered the Super Combo, which comes with the burger, fries and drink. The combo is a good price but for food wise, not to my liking. The burger, even though with double patty and cheese, it's way too small and super flat. Fries were ok, I had better, and there weren't even a lot.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I'm usually not a burger person but their vegetarian burger sold me! 

I ordered...

VEGGIE BURGER: 
This came with a vegetarian patty, hummus, tomatoes, lettuce, & cucumber. I asked for extra tomatoes & cucumber w/ no extra charge. This burger was very flavorful & filled with fresh ingredients. 

GARLIC FRIES: My friends ordered these & said it was delicious. The fries were the right crispiness & the garlic wasn't overpowering. 

TIP: Getting their homemade pickles are a must! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE: Quick & friendly.
author: Phuong H.

description:
Believe the hype. 

This is a high quality and  perfectly sized burger. The beef was cooked to a perfect medium and was very tender and juicy. The receptionist was very nice and extended a warm welcome when she found out that this was my first visit. Overall a great experience from start to finish. 

WARNING: Role your sleeves up. The dry cleaners next door hope that you won't.
author: Ben L.

description: I'm a big burger fan and this place certainly didn't disappoint! From their friendly service to their juicy burgers, I'll most definitely be back!
author: Kristina J.

description:
Waiting for my friend to get off work I wandered inside to find this Burger joint. I liked the fact that they use organic cream from a small, family owned, organic farm for their soft serves. I love supporting the smaller shops as best I can. 

So I decided to order a dipped cone and noticing they had garlic fries I knew I couldn't pass that up. The person who took our order was quite stoic and not very friendly. I figured it was probably because it was 6pm and towards the end of the work day.

The dipped cone reminded me of the dipped ice cream at Wiz Bang Bar in Portland except with limited flavors. It was a vanilla soft serve with a hard chocolate shell with a traditional soft serve cone. The vanilla flavor was pretty standard, but the chocolate shell was the highlight. It was a nice thin cool piece of chocolate. I really liked how it added more texture to my soft serve. And for only $4 it was a very nice after work treat!

The garlic fries were one of the best fries I have ever had next to the baseball garlic fries I can only get when I go to a game. The fries were freshly fried and perfectly crisp. The aged cheddar was generously portioned with fresh garlic. IT was so good! Afterwards I had a bit of garlic breath, but it was well worth it. And it was only $3.25 so way cheaper than other places!

I need to come back and try one of their burgers next time :)
author: Melissa N.

description:
I was craving a burger for lunch and since I work closeby, i just yelped a nearby, good, burger joint and Super Duper came up!

I love the bread that they use instead of normal burger bread. It really makes the burger pretty great. I haven't tried the beef burger, but I ordered the  chicken burger and found it to be quite satisfying. Their fries area also delicious.

They have a lunchtime deal as well, which makes it easy to order and, I'm sure, convenient for customers. 

The wait time isn't all that bad even though I went in during the lunch time rush. I took my order to go and I waited around 10 minutes I would say- maybe even less. Food tasted fresh and I would definitely recommend to others and go again!
author: Bori B.

description:
I'm a fan of consistency when places have +1 location and Super Duper nailed it - at least between the two I've visited. Burger was perfect, juicy & delicious. Fries rocked, perfectly crisp, not greasy, added a little salt and they were practically perfect! 

Will definitely keep Super Duper on my short list when in the heart of downtown.
author: Kevin K.

description: Love this place. The burgers are juicy and the unlimited pickles is awesome!  During lunch hour the que can get quite long but it also moves fairly quickly. Plenty of seating in the lower floor. Get your soda/water from the ground level (no fountain machine at lower level). Condiments are provided at the lower level
author: Henry T.

description:
There are things in this world that is just the same. Nothing much really to them, you can go to almost anywhere and get something either the same or similar. Just..Regular. When it comes to "Burgers" this is where places tend to be similar or just.."Duper" which to me means "The Same" but this place is anything but "Duper" in fact it's "Super Duper"..Super the Same? Well it's the same because its a "Burger" but "Super" because its out of the ordinary. Super Duper Burgers is like my other favorite burger place (The Habit) on ROIDS! and well to be honest....my forming habit my have shifted to Super Duper Burgers. Here is my review!

5/12/16
I was feeling good this day, I had a pocket full of dough, I was day 3 into my mini vacation after my exit from my "Former" job and I remember bookmarking "Super Duper Burgers" a while ago after seeing a few of my friends in the "Yelpdom" write great reviews and brag about the awesomeness that this place is. After hanging with "Porsche C". On my birthday, I remember on our Uber ride to my faaaaaaaavvvvorite hangout in SF "North beach" we passed by this location. And low and behold this was one of the spots I bookmarked. So naturally I knew I was going to go, plus I had planned it in my mind to go on this day. So I polished my "Gold Chains" and threw on something nice and set off to SF.

Service 5/5
Food 5/5
Cleanliness 4/5

I get to SF an hour early, I did that on purpose so I could fully take in the experience. And good thing I got there when I did because it was "Happy Hour" and happy hour at a burger joint you may ask yourself....well yea "Happy Hour at a Burger Joint" they serve "Beer" here and you can buy it by the pitcher if you want! Pretty cool huh!

Food:
I got in and took a look at the menu and knew what I wanted. I got the Super Burger (two 8oz beef patties) with Super Sauce $7.75 and I added Cheese $.75 and what's a Burger without Bacon? $1.00 and I added Garlic Fries $3.25 and a Glass of Red Racer IPA aka "Beer" $5.00 to make it a combo $15.50 all together and that is with the $2.75 off the fries for "Happy Hour" because the fries are free if you buy a "Beer, during happy hour (garlic fries are $.50 during happy hour) 

The burger was everything I expected it to be. It was amazing....The meat tasted so fresh and clean and it was cooked at a nice medium. The Onions which I had fresh (although a grilled option is on the menu) was crisp and complimented the nice taste of the meat along with the lettuce which didn't seem to wilt up too much from the heat of the burger. The buns were lightly toasted and held up to the over all make up of this masterpiece.

The Garlic Fries are hands down the "Best" garlic fries I've ever had. Just make sure to have some mints or gum handy though if you plan to be social after eating these. The fries were crispy and fresh and stayed hot. The garlic infused oil topped with minced garlic and parmesan cheese completed this simple yet "Super" experience for me. I honestly wished I had a bigger tray of them.

Will I go back here?

Um....That's a big YES! Like this place took that thang, flipped it and reversed it and made it into something new. I would love to see a Super Duper Burger near my neck of the woods.

In Conclusion, I personally never thought I would develop a love affair with a burger joint. Let alone one in San Francisco which to me is a "Yelpers" paradise of good eats. But Super Duper Burgers is worthy of all the praise I've given it, and this location off Kearny St about a block away from Montgomery St Bart is where I been too so I can't speak for other locations just yet. But if you in SF and want a Burger I say come here and get one. Happy Hour is Mon - Fri 4pm to Close and Sat 2pm to 7pm. I say come here and see for yourself if you've never been. As always Yelp your own "Super" experience!
author: Tre S.

description: The place is a good place for quick eats. I had the garlic fries and veggie burger. The service was good and quick. The staff friendly. The fries are tasty. However, their veggie burger misses the mark for me. It had a lot of textures happening. I do appreciate that a vegetarian option is provided. With that said I will probably try them again possibly another burger.
author: Natasha W.

description: Pretty yummy burgers, fresh and made to order. The cheese was melted nicely and I enjoyed their grilled onions. They gave free doughnuts too! I'd recommend going before 1130am before the working lunch crowd comes.
author: Jamie L.

description: So it's Wednesday 12 noon and they have no more beef patties. What more can I say? #FAIL #WheresTheBeef
author: Mike W.

description: These burgers were great.  It was more expensive than I would think for burgers, but ended up being a good lunch.  The special sauce was basically "fry sauce" so if your a utahan like me you will appreciate having that on your burger.  I added an organic egg on top of my burger with Avacado and grilled onions and I really liked it.  The burger was cooked tender.  The garlic fries could have used a little more garlic, but otherwise the meal was a hit with the whole family.  The place was clean and staff was friendly.
author: Brooke P.

description:
I love Super Duper burgers for lunch and for dinner, and now I also love Super Duper's breakfast sandwiches. Their breakfast sandwich is a fried egg on an English muffin, which you can customize by adding sausage, bacon, avocado, tomato, or cheese. The sandwich is made to order and is served hot off the grill. 

If you're extra hungry, you can also have delicious mini donuts on the side.
author: Allen T.

description: I got to said that the reputation is true, good taste and the mini burgers have a decent size
author: Gelis L.

description: Came to this location during the Monday lunch rush with some colleagues and was pleased with how the staff was able to handle the long line. Despite the crowd, we didn't have to wait very long to get our orders. The restaurant is very spacious, so finding a seat was a non-issue. The food itself, as with other Super Duper locations, was great. Always a fan of the garlic fries.
author: Dylan L.

description:
This place is SOOOO delicious!!! The mini burger is the perfect size (less than $5) if you're not a big eater and the garlic fries are freakin delicious. They do happy hour until closing on the weekdays, which means you get a free order of garlic fries with an order of beer. My friend and I shared a tangerine wheat beer, which should have meant that we got free garlic fries...but no, the server overcharged us for a combo instead :/ it should have been $10 total but he charged us $13 for a "drink+fries+burger" combo which is like???? Cause shouldn't the server know about the happy hour LOL
Anyhoo stingy nitpicking aside, the burger here is truly delicious and juicy. I got the grilled onions and  chilis inside as well and it added so much flavor. The fries are super garlicky and I like how long they are!! PLUS I love the endless supply of pickles they have next to the delicious ketchup container. They're spicy pickles marinated in chilis and I LOVED them with my hamburger! 
The taste is 6 stars!! But the mispricing makes my review 4 stars
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description: Happy Hour with $15 pitcher and two fries or something. What else you want? Burgers are delicious and filling if you double up on the patty. It's definitely on the oily side and I still think In N Out is better, but it's a close one. But In N Out doesn't serve alcohol. There's a downstairs with sports on, so it's a great place to kick it with coworkers if you get to leave the office early and watch some games. It's like the Shake Shack of the West.
author: TJ P.

description:
I usually go to the Market location but this place was closer when I ended up grabbing lunch with a friend in the area. This location is central being on Kearney. They have an upstairs and downstairs area, so even during the lunch rush we were able to grab a table. 

I usually get a mini burger but this time I decided to be adventurous and grab their chicken sandwich. Unlike the burger the chicken sandwich is pretty plain and you have to pay extra for anything else you'd like to have on it like bacon, cheese, etc. The chicken sandwich itself was huge, they definitely don't skimp on the chicken. The bread held up well with the chicken/lettuce/bacon/and cheese. I felt that the chicken was seasoned pretty well but it wasn't crazy spectacular. I ended up eating only half of the sandwich. Honestly, it's a solid alternative to their burgers, but it's not something that I would really crave. 

The service was great though and the place was clean.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Super Duper Burgers delivers a pretty solid experience across all their restaurants. However, I really enjoyed the customer service at this location and appreciated the lively atmosphere of the downstairs floor. After waiting in a slow line, the person at the cashier was very friendly and the small chit chat exchange made the wait not so bad. 

Jenga on the tables downstairs and a HUGE connect 4 table. Twas pretty cool

Garlic fries and added avocado on my mini burger also gave my meal a little something extra.

ALSO HH on Fridays 4-closing with $15 pitchers or $5 pints with free fries! How great
author: Carissa G.

description:
*** In Short ***

Super Duper is Super Duper is Super Duper, but with (oftentimes free) doughnuts and breakfast!

*** In Depth ***

For there are some differences between the various downtown locations of Super Duper in terms of how (literally) well-cooked their burgers are, they are, for the most part, pretty similar, so I won't bother reviewing this one separately, aside from wanting to call out a few notable non-burger-related differences: this location is one of the few that serves up breakfast, which includes doughnuts and breakfast biscuits (think Egg McMuffin). If you come in around lunchtime, they'll oftentimes have extra doughnuts from breakfast that are up for grabs after you've ordered or picked up your food. That, combined with plentiful seating downstairs definitely gives this particular location bonus points!
author: Johnny W.

description: I came here with my brother on a Saturday afternoon. We both ordered chicken sandwiches with garlic fries I added the fried egg to mine.  It was  pretty good. The meat was cooked well and the were flavorful. I really liked the atmosphere in there. They had a foosball table, jenga and some other games/entertainment setup in the dining area. Definitely worth a shot.
author: Tanveer S.

description: Burgers are soooo yum!! And the fries are always a go too! Best of all- the pickles!! Grab some to add to your burger and there is nothing better
author: Jasmine H.

description: Good if overpriced burgers. Service here is typically San Francisco-aloof, and they really need to do a better job of keeping the place cleaner for the prices that they charge. Less hipster employee chatter and more cleaning please thanks!
author: D C.

description:
It was kinda getting late for the kids and we needed a quick place a grab a bite to eat. We stumble upon into Super Duper Burgers. It wasn't busy and we were all hungry from walking around the city plus their burgers looks very tasty. 

Service was simple and quick. Order at the counter, go grab yourself an open table and wait for them to call on your number.

Food: We got the Mini Burger and The Super Duper w/ super sauce and cheese. The burgers were actually pretty darn good. Not because we were starving. I mean the patties well season and cook perfectly med rare. Just an all around great burger. 

Garlic Fries were good. Nothing to brag about.
author: Kevin P.

description:
I know, people don't really show up at Super Duper for a salad, but since this place popped up right by work, and I can't possibly eat beef everyday, I've really developed a love for their chicken salad. If you've ever had the pleasure of noming on their chicken sandwich, you'll be pleased that it's the exact same grilled, juicy, fabulous chicken. Add some avocado and it makes for a very hearty, filling lunch. AND! It only sets you back about $10. 

If you're feeling like you're being too healthy for your own good, order a kid size chocolate shake. It's really the perfect size to satisfy your sweet tooth without breaking your New Year's resolution.
author: Natasha P.

description: A true gem in the middle of a expensive town.  Wandered in when I saw a sign for $15 pitchers and figured I needed to hydrate.   Solid beer selection.  Ordered a pitcher of downtown brown and was informed that it also included 3 orders of fries.   Chose garlic cheese fries paired with homemade pickles.   Will definitely be back
author: Eric E.

description: I went in I work close by basically the lady at the register over talked me and ended up messing up my order because she kept talking ... please just let the customer order and just write it down don't over talk the customer and confuse them which causes u to mess up the order smh ... other than that food was delicious
author: DeL G.

description:
I want to give a shout out to Nayeli! For her excellent customer service. The burger was delicious as expected! 
Thank you Nayeli! You're amazing!
author: Sandro A.

description: Found this place while we were staying at the Omni Hotel for the night....We yelped burgers and BAMMMMMMMM.....Super Duper Burgers came up....All I can say is DEEEEEELISH, one of the best burgers I have had in a long time.....Your chocolate malt was spot on and the fries where hot and nummy.....Check these guys out when your SF, you won't be disappointed
author: Roni J.

description:
This Super Duper is in the middle of the financial district. Good for those of us that work nearby but I won't be coming back. They hustle you through the line, don't pay attention to what you're ordering and act like robots! I had ordered a mini burger and fries and wondered why my total came out to $6.00. I look at my receipt after ordering only to realize my fries weren't ordered. Oh well, I thought...I'll be satisfied with just a burger. The burger was disgusting! It was overcooked and the hamburger patty was literally crumbling. I felt like I should have gotten cheese so it would keep it "glued" together. The burger was overly salty and I needed to douse it in ketchup just so I could swallow it. Needless to say, I won't be coming back here ever!

2016 Review #48
author: Stephanie G.

description: Usually I love super duper, but my breakfast sandwich from here this morning is cold!
author: Kerry G.

description: Love this place. Staff is friendly but I wanted to give a special shout out to the kitchen staff. I was here with a couple of coworkers during rush hour and there was a line to the door. The kitchen staff took care of everyone so gracefully and the food we ordered were perfect. Definitely recommend this location, friendly staff but lost importantly messy yummy burgers!
author: Bella I.

description:
I am a super duper fan of Super Duper Burgers but this certain location performed substandard compared to their other locations.

The mini-burger I ordered was really really dry. It didn't taste juicy like the other burgers I have been accustomed to. Fries were stale too and not appetizing. I am also a huge lemonade fan, so I decided to try out their fresh lemonade w/ brown sugar. It was absolutely disgusting and I didn't finish my drink. 

I remember when there was only SDB! In the blink of an eye, there's now there's six of them in the city. Perhaps Super Duper Burgers is getting too big for its own britches and sacrificing quality control for profits?
author: Philip M.

description:
This place is clean and spacious. Friendly, fast services. The food is good. Have not had a bad experience here yet. (knock on wood). 

My go to is the mini burger with added egg, bacon or avocado. Too messy when I order all 3 add on all at once. Always get fries because its crispy. Free PICKLES! love that.
author: Sandy B.

description:
I walk past this place everyday on the way to work. I was hungry so my coworker and I decided to try it. It was raining today and I went out to get our lunch. When I got there it was pretty empty for 12 noon. It was clean. I got in line and was helped by employee who looked and acted like she wanted to be anywhere but there. I told her that I needed to order seperatly and one order would be paid in cash and the other order would be paid by credit card. I told her my coworker's order a min cheeseburger. My order was a super duper burger combo with only mustard (she said you put that on yourself over there), grilled onions, and bacon. She repeated my order back, "You want a super duper burger with onions, lettuce, tomatoes, and bacon?" I said no and repeated again. I don't understand when I go anywhere to get food people DO NOT LISTEN. It is like why are you asking if you are on autopilot and because most people order around the same thing you just assume that's my order. I made sure after I paid that she knew I didn't want the sauce because I can't have diary.

My total came to $15.56 (pretty steep)
Combo Super Fries Soda-13.00
Bacon-1.25
tax-1.21
SF Bag ordinance- 0.10

I walked back to the office with two paper bags in my hand, soda, and umbrella. When I got to my office I had to put the mustard and ketchup on my burger (please start doing this for your customers) I don't eat McDonald's put they put mustard and ketchup on their burgers, why can't you. The burger was alright it was greasy the bun on the bottom was soaked in grease. Comparing it to  Habit in Alameda, CA since the burger size is around the same and they offer a double burger as well, Habit is better, and better price for what you get. The fries were disgusting, I wish I just got the burger, the soda was on the small size (cup). Overall I won't be going back for that price. My coworker said his burger was ok.
author: Liyah S.

description:
I work very near and eat here probably way too often. I was also here for the grand opening of this location a while back. I have told people many times that Super Duper is one of my favorite, if not my favorite burger place in the Bay Area. 

This location however seems to be going a little down hill. Still a great burger but service seems to be slipping and the downstairs area seems to get less care and cleaning than it used to. One of the bathrooms hasn't flushed right for a few weeks and I have had a correct a few orders.

Still a great place to meet up and hang out. And you can't beat the free fries with beer or wine happy hour. I will be back many more times, I just hope I caught it on bad days and it isn't a trend.
author: Andrew S.

description:
My friend and I spent a day adventuring around San Francisco and needed a spot to stop for a drink and a snack. We were heading to a cocktail bar I knew of when we passed by Super Duper's sign advertising 'free fries with a purchase of beer' (or wine, I think). It was just the deal we hoped for... but we kept passing until we reached the cocktail bar - but it was closed, oh wait duh, it's still super early in the day. So we made our way back to Super Duper and the too good to be true deal.

I ordered a Racer 5 IPA (there were only 2 other beer options, this seemed to be the best pick imo) and got the garlic fries for just a $0.50 upgrade! Our fries came out fast - with a big pile of garlic and cheese on top! The fries were reeeeeeaaaaaaaallllllyyyyy greasy though. It left a puddle at the bottom of the paper bowl and I had to pass on the fries that were drowning in the oils. They were also kind of cold... but they were still so good for being free!! Well, semi-free.

We sat upstairs at the window - kinda cool view out into the alleyway with all the other restaurants in it. More seating downstairs - really clean and lots of seating.

I'm not sure if the other locations have the free fries deal (please tell me if they do!!!) but it's an awesome one and I would go out of my way just to come to this one! I haven't had the burgers at this location yet.
author: Shanise M.

description:
Solid chain for their burgers, signature pickles and for the lunch time flow. 

There's a downstairs to this place with sports tvs and a surprising foosball table as well as a big-sized connect 4 to play on the communal table!

This one is laid back and I like the vibe the most, compared to all the Super Duper places I've been to thus far.  Because they have their happy hour on combo pitcher of beer with fries, this spot is preferred and a sure win to draw in a crowd during those hours - especially with its perks only provided here. 

This one is pretty rad.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
After drinking nearby, we were hungry! A certain ramen spot nearby had a huge line, so we all decided on burgers for dinner. It was Tuesday, August 25th around 8:30pm.

*Mini burger: 4oz - 1 patty, with super sauce ($5.50)
add Cheese (+$0.50)
add Bacon (+$1)
add Roasted portobello (+$1)
with Everything on it: lettuce, tomato, red onions
And Jalapeno peppers, Grilled onions, Pickles
*Garlic fries: fresh garlic and 6 month aged cheddar ($3.25)

I love their mini burger. Tender and juicy. I was debating adding an egg to it, but the bacon, cheese and mushroom were actually perfect. I didn't eat the bun, so maybe next time I should tell them no bun? Not sure if they have a protein style or whatever Super Duper calls it. Make sure to grab some pickles from the condiment bar as they don't actually put them in the burgers. I've always enjoyed their garlic fries. Crispy and garlicky with a little cheesiness.

What's a burger without a beer? A perfect combo, no? I got a Beer on tap ($5): Tangerine wheat beer, Lost coast brewery, Eureka, CA. It quenched my thirst. One of my friend's paired his burger with a Super shake ($5.75): Double chocolate & chips. I didn't try it, but it looked delish!

The service here was awesome, which is why I'm giving them 5 stars. One of our cashiers precisely rattled off burger additions, both paid and free. I was impressed. And he also let us know we qualified for free fries. I don't think any of my other friends were told this.

Super Duper always delivers a solid burger. This location also offers solid service!
author: Elena N.

description: This YELP review comes from somebody that has dined at a Super Duper at least 30 times since the Bay Area mini chain opened. There are plenty of reviews, so I'll keep it simple...in my opinion, for the bang and the buck, Super Duper Burgers are the best! I've had San Francisco burgers from Roam, Umami, Gott's, In-N-Out, Mo's, Brenda's, Zuni Cafe, etc, etc, but Super Duper is my number one choice. The menu is simple, which is how a burger joint should be. I add bacon, cheese, and a fried egg to my burger, each at an additional charge. The bacon is premium, not your run of the mill bacon, and the egg is usually fried perfectly runny, sunny side up. The extra additions are definitely worth it! The fries are awesome, the soft serve is awesome, the free homemade pickles are awesome. If you wish, have your burger with a tasty draft beer or a delicious shake (you can get it spiked with vodka). They've somewhat recently added a special burger menu (see attached picture). The Blue Cheese burger, to which I additionally add bacon, is just too damm delicious! As you would expect, ambiance varies slightly from their various locations, but their product and service is consistent. Enjoy!
author: Joe P.

description:
Came here for lunch on Friday around noon. There was a fairly long line but it moved rather quickly and we were able to order and get our food in 20 minutes or so. If you want to dine in, there's plenty of space in the downstairs area.

The food itself was average. The burgers were extremely greasy and very filling. I got a mini-burger but it felt like eating a regular burger. However, I was disappointed by the garlic fries. These fries come with "6 month old aged cheese" but it was more like cheese with fries. It seemed like half of the "fries" was the cheese. Won't be getting the garlic fries the next time I come.

My favorite part of this place is definitely the free pickles. I can see myself coming back here, but honestly more for the pickles than the food.
author: Cassie Z.

description: I love this place. Love the special burger and their chicken sandwich. You can add bacon to your burger or double up on the patty or both!! Their chocolate milkshake is decadent. Definitely gonna be a regular here
author: Ashmita V.

description: I love Super Duper. Can't really go wrong with any of their locations in the city. It definitely has one of my favorite veggie burgers in the city. Highly recommend getting the side of three sauces with your fries. Also the shakes are legit. Overall just really good, "I'm tipsy on my way to more bars but need food in my stomach" vibes.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Really appreciate the manager's private message and comment to my review immediately after posting.  He definitely seems concerned about customer satisfaction and service.
author: Cat C.

description:
Honestly it has been a challenge finding a cool place for my 1,800th review. Though many of you know one of my favorites is a good burger. Therefore my milestone review will be the newest Super Duper burger restaurant in the Financial District. 

The newest restaurant was previously a Burger King, a taqueria and something else.  Hence all three had failed. With the friendly staff helping me on my debut, I have high optimism on this new spot.

On my debut, I was still in the restaurant's Happy Hour zone. The deal is a free order of fries with a brew purchase. From one of three local micro-brews on tap, I ordered a tall glass of Racer-5 Indian Pale Ale (IPA) for $5.00. I also ordered the famous Double Cheeseburger for $7.00 separately to complete my dinner. I also added an egg topping for an additional $1.00. The burger patty is greasier and thicker than the other locations, including the two down on Market Street and Yerba Buena Garden. The fries are also thicker and longer too. The burger and fries tasted well with the Sonoma County brew. 

Though the closing hours are shorter and earlier than the other location, I think this new Super Duper has found a new home in the Financial District and gained a regular in myself!
author: Matt G.

description:
This location is close enough to the hustle and bustle of the Financial District that anyone planning on snagging a quick lunch should be mindful of the lunch hour rush (11:00 am - 1:00 pm). Despite the crowds that can flock, the longest wait time I've experienced has been 10 minutes and that was because the person ahead of me placed an order for their office. The team at this location has always been friendly and quick to get the orders in and out.

My only complaint is the burgers at this location always seem greasier than the other locations. A saddening reality check when one is trying to forget about TRYING to eat healthy ;)
author: Caroline T.

description:
My co-worker and I took an Uber to get here from work to meet an ex-co-worker for lunch.  The Uber driver had a good laugh with us about other Uber drivers that don't belong on the road.  So, we warned him, if he ever needs to take Uber himself and sit in a car that smells like poop with an attempt to masked the stink with strawberry fresheners, then RUN, run very far.  Because not only will you get a snail driver with the biggest iPad duct-taped (YES TAPED DOWN, honey!) to the beverage holder but she will give you religious reading material at the end of the ride!  Worst Uber experience ever!  Don't trust an Uber driver with poopy smelly cars.

As with all the Super Dupers, this was as tasty as all the locations.  Mini with cheese and a side of garlic fries!  It's the best and still the best no matter which location you go to.  There's plenty of tables upstairs and downstairs.  The service is friendly.  And the home jarred pickles are the best!
author: Jenny T.

description: Awesome. Cheaper than anything else in the area and good taste. Didn't have a burger, but my chicken sandwich was awesome and my gf's veggie burger was great too. The parmesan garlic fries were very tasty and I didn't expect to have actual shredded and melted parmesan cheese. We ate in the basement where every table had Jenga and there was a foosball table in the back where a family had a match up.
author: Justin G.

description: Great place for a burger and fries in the Financial District.  Fries are fresh cut and served fresh and hot.  I am not a fan of their ketchup but not a deal breaker.  Love the burgers with juicy meat patties and fresh produce!   Writing this has me craving one!  Service is fast and friendly.  Get there early for a seat.
author: Dennis R.

description:
Was in town for.business and wanted a good burger. This place cane high recommended so.I had to try. Okay,  first impression,  WTF $19 for a Burger, fries, and Milkshake. I'm willing to pay for good food but dang $20 for a Burger is a bit much. 

The condiments are off to the side.  Please get the ketchup,  that is all.

I got my food to go which was a mistake. Although my walk back to my hotel was less than 5 minutes my fries were cold. It was to be expected but surprisingly still good! If you don't like garlic, you better skip these because the garlic is THERE, like HELLO I'm garlic there. The Burger was still warm and yup, it was nice and greasy but oh so freaking good! If you dont like grease stay clear. The bread was soaked in greasy goodness. The meat was really flavorful and not overly thick or too thin.

The disappointment was the lettuce and tomato was not up to par for the money I spent  and they left my bacon off my burger. I paid  $1 extra for that swine. Lesson learned.  Always check your to go order.

I will give the Cookies and Cream Milkshake a A+++++. It's worth the hefty price.

Overall, I would go back for the  Milkshake and a mini burger.
author: Tasha C.

description: Overall this is a place to go when you crave for burgers. I always have to add extra cheese and bacon and they never failed to deliver a very delicious burger. I think they have better have a bacon cheese burger on the menu so it would make everyone's job easier. Good value for money.
author: Fikret D.

description:
These burgers make me feel tingly in special places. I kind of can't even handle how much I love Super Duper's messy, juicy, greasy (in a good way!) burgers. And their cookies and cream shake... Aghhhh just stop. I want to order 3 and drink them all and then then put on stretchy pants. 

There are multiple Super Dupers in the city, but you should know that this location on Kearny has the nicest staff!!! The cashier's smile was so big that I wondered if I had bird poop in my hair. I checked, and I didn't. They're just super freakin nice there. 

There's a nice spacious downstairs area with TVs, so you drink 3 milkshakes and watch a game. I'm going to do that soon. You should too.
author: Liz M.

description:
I recently tried out this location because it's so close to work. Surprisingly when I came here last week, there was a long line out the door but it moved fast!

I feel I would always choose In n Out over super duper; it's just a slightly more expensive version of it. Their mini burger is very mini like a snack size rather than a full on meal. If you're hungry, I would recommend the super burger with two patties. You have options of adding cheese, bacon, or egg in your burger! For sides, I have tried both their garlic and regular fries and this time around got the trio of sauces which is worth getting at least once! Add the sauces onto your burger too! And lastly, I always have to try out a shake if I haven't just yet! I got their chocolate one which was pretty good and was a decent size; the boyfriend got a scrimshaw on tap. Bill came out to be about $30ish which is a little expensive for me and small burgers IMO, but service is friendly and seating doesn't seem to be a problem here as they have inside and outside options. Most people seem to get their food to go as it's a heavy foot traffic area. 

I want to try their soft serve cones here at least once! Looks like a decent sweet treat on a hot day!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Oh! Em! Gee!  This is heaven when you have soy and dairy allergies!!!  They make their own mayonnaise (eggs and canola oil) and the special sauce and Caesar dressing are also soy and dairy free.  Ditto for the ciabatta bread.  I ate like a normal person... chicken sandwich on ciabatta with mayo.  The only thing I couldn't have were cheese and the chipotle aioli (it has yogurt).  They have an allergen binder, and the counter person went through all my questions with me.  She was extremely helpful, and didn't make me feel like a pain in the neck for having a ton of allergies (soy and dairy are the tip of the iceberg).  Price was reasonable for the financial district and the food was SCRUMPTIOUS!  So glad this is just a couple doors from my office in SFO.
author: Lee B.

description: awesome, quick, and friendly service! burgers are great, full of flavor, and tasted as good as they smelled from the outside of the restaurant! Definitely recommend this spot and after the first bite, you can see how the ratings for this franchise all over the city is high.
author: Danbee T.

description: My colleagues and I made a stop here for some grub during a conference trip.  One of them had heard of this and had wanted to give it a shot.  It was quite good. I got mine with an egg on top.  It was not dry, very good in fact.  Definitely recommend this for a quick grab.
author: Jason D.

description:
I looove the fries here. My favorite fries ever! The regular fries are not too oily, perfectly cooked-- crispy on the outside and still soft and potato-y on inside. :D

I come here sometimes to grab dinner to bring home to the bf or even come for lunch (which is conveniently located down the street from my office). The lunch rush can get a bit cray and long, but the food doesn't take TOO long. (certainly longer than other fast food joints) 

What I love:

- fries on fries on fries.
- chicken sandwich (no sauce) add egg
- veggie burger (rice base patty and hummus as the spread?!? YAAS.)
- dat chocolate shake tho (bf loves it)

There is plenty of seating and sometimes they give out samples of delicious donuts!
author: Maggie Y.

description:
Since I was looking for a whole30 compliant meal, I asked many questions regarding their ingredients. The cashiers and cooks happily answered ALL my questions. They use canola oil which is technically okay on the program, but I skipped the grilled onions. 

I ordered:
-Mini burger (wasn't feeling two patties at the time) -- lettuce-wrapped burger with tomatoes, raw onions, (on the side - pickles). I added avocado & bacon which was a great choice!

I loved the medium cook on the burger and how juicy & flavorful it was! I will definitely come back again on my lunch break.
author: Alpacalunchforus 1.

description: UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!!! So after posting my review as stated earlier......never got the gift card as promised(They claimed "lost in the mail"..lol!! I continued going there because I live around the corner and just put my own onions on my burger when i get home! Last week got a burger and started eating it and almost chocked on a Salt package!! I was home...dont use those salt and pepper packs...ruined the burger...full of salt!! Like an ASS I go back yesterday...got home..they gave me a single patty with bacon and jalapeno....I ordered a double no chese!! Kinda thinking on purpose now or they're just IDIOTS!! One more thing....TRY....I DARE YOU....TRY to call a order in over phone...They NEVER NEVER NEVER answer the phone...NEVER!! I was actually calling them when I was ordering yesterday and brought it to their attention.....they lied until I showed them my phone was calling them at that time.....Gee...funny...phone wasn't ringing!! In the last 8-9 times I've called an order in...think they picked up once!! DONE...PLEASE don't text me Super Burger again........DONE...Don't want no phantom gift card....your excuses why you never answer the phone....giving me salt pack in my burger including wrong burger!! DONE!!
author: Craig T.

description: I ordered a 1/2 lb burger combo with garlic fries and a small Oreo shake. The burger was cooked perfectly, and the flavor really surprised me. One of the best burgers I have had anywhere. Garlic was a little too strong on the fries, I think I would get regular next time. If you're carving for a quick and nice burger, this is the place. Tasty well flavored burger, fantastic french fries. Fast and friendly counter service.
author: Aaron T.

description: Burgers, fries and ice cream- a classic trio! I have to say that i loved the chicken sandwich and lemonade. The ice cream cone was the perfect top off to the whole meal. Visiting notes- counter service, there is more seating downstairs, picnic tables and community board games for your enjoyment. Quick lunch and/or hangout spot.
author: Raquel C.

description: My first time at a Super Duper Burger was today & it was phenomenal! I'm a huge burger foodie, one of my favorite foods EVER & this burger was to die for. The food was amazing, the staff was helpful & friendly, & the atmosphere was super pleasant. I will definitely be coming here when I'm in the city & also will be checking out other locations!!
author: Sierra B.

description:
I ordered the mini meal with bacon and cheese, and replaced the fountain drink with the cookies and cream shake. The mini burger meal hits the spot for me every single time! The meal includes a mini burger - one 4oz patty cooked medium with super sauce, fries, and a fountain drink all for $9.25. They also offer FREE toppings like, lettuce, tomato, red onions, jalapeños, green onions, and homemade pickles. For a little extra you can get cheese for $.75 or bacon for $1.

If you're really hungry and you don't think you'll get food coma, order the super burger meal and that includes two 4oz patties, fries, and a fountain drink for $11.25.

The meal is very juicy so prepare to have a lot of napkins on the side. If you plan to eat inside, they have a few tables upstairs, and another room downstairs with the bathrooms. Try to come here before 12:30 cause around that time you'll see the line out the door and around the corner.
author: Tina M.

description: You gotta have good burgers to impress a meat loving foodie like me. Super Duper, ya doing okay. I like your concept. I like the size of your burgers. I enjoy the toppings you use. It definitely works if you feel like having a burger, without having to go to a fastfood chain, or sit down at a restaurant. The ambience of Super Duper was actually surprisingly good! I walked upstairs right away after coming in, but go check out the downstairs area. It is pretty spacious down there! Compliments for adding boxes with Jenga blocks to the tables. Stacking a sturdy tower while eating is interesting but fun haha! Super Duper also scores because of their fries! High fives for seasoning your fries! Gosh... The garlic fries are a piece of art and are so yummy.
author: Kirstin G.

description: Awesome burgers!!!! Very tasty and service was quick. Portion sizes were perfect. Burgers and fries are one of my favorites. Loved that the patties were hand made on the spot and the choices were simple. Will visit this place again for sure!
author: Lahela S.

description: I mean...is there another word for F'n Delicious??? Wow, burgers are on point! Don't bother getting the mini, go for the Super Burger! And the garlic fries with cheese thrown on top? The milkshakes? I am so full it hurts but I wish I could keep eating! Can't wait to come here again and eat everything. The service was awesome, everyone is so sweet and happy here! This is hands down an SF fav!  Thank you so much!!!!
author: Kathleen F.

description: Amazing!  Probably my #2 favorite burger.  Everything about this burger is perfect.  It's a little pricey compared to my #1 (pssst... IN N Out), but it's worth it.  I'm craving this place.  For breakfast, forsake the fries and go for the donuts.  Salty and sweet.... so perfect.
author: L D.

description:
This place is great and affordable. Burgers, fries, house made pickles and mini donuts, they even do breakfast combos for $5. 

I had a veggie burger from here for the first time (I'm not a vegetarian, I was just curious) and was surprised that it had so much flavor! I would definitely recommend. 

My only complaint would be that they don't use the really crunchy iceberg lettuce, instead they use a leafier kind, it's not bad, I just miss the crunch.
author: Elena K.

description: Mm this location is the least appealing of the 3 I've been to in SF.. came here for dinner on a Wednesday and they were out of donuts (okay healthier) Biggest complaint is that there is no convenient street bike parking nearby (unhealthier). The inside seems kind of empty to me and the water cups are plastic. Veggie burger is still the same aka delicious, I just don't take to the atmosphere in here, even though they do have games which is fun.
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description: The burgers tasted like pickles. As someone who HATES pickles this really ruined my experience in this otherwise friendly and quirky restaurant. The garlic fries were good but not worth coming back for by themselves due to the pickleburger.
author: Leo V.

description:
Super Duper is my Treat Yourself place.

They have this killer breakfast deal where you can a fresh breakfast sandwich with a fresh egg (not those microwaved ones), a mini donut, and a cup of coffee (not just any coffee, four barrel coffee for coffee enthusiast) for only $5 dollars! You can upgrade to a large coffee and 3 donuts for $7. This deal is just too good to pass up!

Breakfast aside, they also have delicious burgers and shakes :) The shakes are delicious and if you're feeling adventurous, you can get it spiked. My only complaint is that the burgers are really really greasy. I can only handle their mini burger because of the grease. Other than that, great spot for anytime of the day.

This location is great but avoid going between 11:30 - 12:30 on weekdays because the lunch crowd is crazy.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Super Duper Burger was pretty Super Duper! Not only to they have delicious organise Sir Ketchup but the burger is the perfect size as a mini (4oz Patty) and the fries were perfectly crisp. They both were just so good together!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Great place, and I love how they source their beef from sustainable and cruelty-free (well, as cruelty-free as they can get) sources. The service is a tad slow- because the lines are so long! Definitely know your order by the time you get there, and take a delicious bite into their burgers.

Don't forget about those garlic fries too! Those are a must if you decide to visit Super Duper.
author: Anders Z.

description:
Best Burger in the area. Previously, the open food court you call Kearny was a waste land of dead dreams and missed opportunities when it came to the burger. Now we have all been saved. Hopefully they will open a second location in the same block or the line will be an hour long from 11:00am until 3:00pm. No matter the wait the quality is always amazing.

There is nothing anywhere around here that has the freshness, juiciness and overall consistent food quality this joint provides. Don't forget that at the same time they always deliver friendly and courteous service.

Get the Double Bacon Cheeseburger with an egg on top! The amount of juice from the meat mixes so well with the consistency of the egg. Every spot I've had this at its always perfect.
author: Justin S.

description:
This rating means a lot, considering the person at the counter made the audacious claim that this would be "the best burger you've ever had."  He went on to say, "if it's not the best, I'll give you a full refund. But if it is, you have to leave me 5 stars on Yelp."  This was the wrong thing to say, as I immediately went into pretentious Yelp snob mode, ready to tear apart anything that went in my mouth...

But oh how my attitude changed after the first bite.

What a fantastic piece of meat!  Hard to say it's really the best burger I've ever had.... but it might be the best burger under $10 in SF I've had.  Sorry In-n-Out - this one is just more burger.  Especially after I added jalapeño, avocado, grilled onions, and more.  Really a treat!
author: Greg B.

description:
All my co-workers had been talking about this so i was like Ok i gotta try this place out.
Ive heard it can get pretty busy during peak hours. I came on my lunch at around 2:00 pm and lucky me there was no line! 

Ordered the Mini Burger! + .50 cents for cheese. A side of fries and a milkshake to satisfy that sweet tooth! Around $13 total. 

The burger was really good. Nice bun too and fresh toppings. French fries were great too had a nice crunch and the milkshake was the best! Ordered a swirl one and it was nice and creamy!! Overall its a great burger joint. Good flavors,nice add ons and they even have some brew & wine. Will return to try the veggie burger!
author: Xochitl T.

description:
The first few times I ate at Super Duper, I thought I had died and gone to heaven. I would have given it 7 stars if I could.

Once the initial euphoria settled down and after eating there dozens of times, it is down to a solid 4. The super duper burger with everything on it and the garlic fries are my go to items and they are great. I do wish there was more burger for the $8 you pay for it.

This location is nice, has seating upstairs and in the basement and the lines are not too crazy and move fast.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Came here 11/18/15

This place is seriously awesome and I'm VERY picky about service and cleanliness. The people at the front were super friendly, but also fast entering my order and easily understood my high maintenance order. 

The vacant tables were all clean and when it's your birthday, they really take care of you. 

Best chocolate shake too especially if you don't like them too sweet. 

Manager came by to check on myself and a colleague and was ridiculously friendly. If you're having a bad day, come here to brighten it.
author: Tamar M.

description:
I have eaten at several of Super Duper's locations: Usually with delicious results.

Perhaps it is that I usually get the mini, which is a single patty. 

However getting the super was just a greasy mess. I believe it is from having a very high fat content. Don't get me wrong I love fat in my burger as it adds the flavor. But...when the whole thing is dripping, slippery, and falling apart...I just didn't find it appealing or appetizing.

The fries were also greasy and limp.

Stick with the mini!
author: David G.

description:
Super Duper recently opened just down the block from my work & this has danger written all over it.....see, I heart their veggie burgers but always found it to be more of a treat b/c it was so far out of the way......but not anymore 

Got "the usual":
+ Veggie Burger w/ added avocado, cheese, jalapenos 
+ Garlic Fries

Comparing to the other SD locations we've tried, have to say this one is totally worthy & shows the awesome consistency I've come to expect in SD......burger perfectly cooked so that it's a bit charred on the edges while remaining moist on the inside

Nice representation of jalapenos & cheese - these are important for my burger enjoyment!

Fries were loaded w/ garlic & cheese & were crispy on the outside, mooshy on the inside - are you seeing a trend? 

I'm excited to have my burger-perfection fix even closer - and I also see a need for elastic-waisted pants in the very near future
author: Adrienne G.

description: All about this veggie burger. They have a happy hour special that does the trick- free fries with any beer or wine purchase. Foosball table is fun too- play some serious games while sippin' on your HH beverage.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Wow, this was an amazing burger. I got the mini burger and added avocados and cheese. The patty is extremely juicy and tender. I loved the soft bun that they used and really have no complaints about my meal at all.

It's self-seating, which was fine since there was ample seating available. Service was good, though I sensed a bit of annoyance from my cashier when I decided last minute that I wanted to add avocados.
author: Ellen J.

description: Great shakes ! They make them from soft serve which is a big plus ! I like my shakes made with ice cream so this place is my new favorite place for shakes ! The strawberry super shake and the chocolate malt are both terrific ! Will definitely come back to try their burgers and their garlic fries.
author: Rahul K.

description:
Visited Super Duper Burger tonight when I had that burger craving. I went for a super burger with cheese, garlic fries and a lemonade.

Burger was delicious and juicy, if perhaps a little bit greasy. It had an amazing flavour and tasted of burger, rather than lots of extra add ons. The garlic fries were brilliant, packed quite the punch of raw garlic. I wont be kissing anyone any time soon, and I'll be keeping the vampires at bay. The lemonade was really tasty and refreshing, definitely worth a go!

I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Johnathan L.

description: This place rocks! The food was fresh and delicious. Those garlic fries hit the spot! I ordered my burger custom and they actually got right right! Extra bacon grilled onions and avocado. Yum! I will definitely be back soon!
author: Ivonne O.

description:
No matter which location you go to, the food and service is consistent.  This is one of the better chain, fast food joints in the area! 

I typically get the mini burger (4oz patty) and garlic fries.  Yum!
author: Gene D.

description: Amazing consistent burgers each time and every time! I suggest adding the organic egg to your burger to be mandatory every time!
author: Bobby C.

description: Hot Damn they got it right...... I work for CPMC Clinical Lab and Pathology Client Services.  My coworkers and I order from Super Duper Burgers all the time thru Postmates, Ubereats, or DoorDash.  Various locations have jack'd up our orders in the past.  But Sonya and her staff at the 346 Kearny street location got it right last Friday. We were a bit busy so the burgers, fries and shake was just what we needed to get thru a rough Friday. Our food came in a timely manner, it was nice and hot, and most of all the orders were correct. THANK YOU AGAIN SONYA!!!  Shot out to our post mate driver Christian B for his part in making sure we was alllllll good. We will be ordering again realllll soon.
author: Wadelx S.

description: One of the worst burgers I have ever had! Not sure if I just had a wrongly made burger, but I was not impressed. I was mostly disappointed because of how much people would hype this place up, and I've never had a time where I had to spit out my burger because of the taste. I'm a huge burger person and was excited to try a new place. I really hope it was the way my burger was made, because I eat burgers almost everywhere I go and I have never been more disappointed.
author: Mina S.

description: I've been going to school in Sf at Cinta Aveda. Super Duper is right across the street from our school. The service and food is amazing! I'm a regular here and they call me by name and know what I like and how I like it! They even suggest other toppings and I love them all! Thank you Super Duper! A true SF gem!
author: Miguel L.

description: Folks taking orders are Not too smart, got our orders all wrong, missed one order completely.
author: Michael T.

description: This place hits the spot every time I crave burgers. Service is fast and friendly. Burgers are juicy and sauce is just delicious. It's not as oily as the other places. Fries are crispy. It's a clean place with lots of seats to enjoy burgers. I would recommend others to try out this place!
author: Amy L.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I've had Super Duper on multiple occasions from various locations around the city. This location is pretty large on the inside, with pretty exposed brick throughout the whole restaurant. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - especially during the busy lunch hour.

Moving on to the food - it's good... But I've had better cheeseburgers in my life. I will say the garlic fries are worth getting. If you need something quick and tasty I would stop in however the food is only a step above fast food.
author: Teresa C.

description: Great atmosphere, juicy burger, delicious pickles. Service was quick enough and the quality of the ingredients was great. Staff was very friendly. Fries were crispy and fresh. Ice cream for dessert was an excellent treat to top it off.
author: Matthew E.

description: Another Solid Super Duper burger! This is the fourth Super Duper burger I've tried in SF and I've got to say they are consistent. This is a cool location close to my work that has two floors (bottom floor has additional seating). It has a fantastic atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. I ordered a mini cheese burger and a strawberry shake. I waited about 5 minutes or so before my food was ready. I liked the downstairs seating quite a bit and the food was very good. Fresh burger with a delicious bun and the milkshake was just great (although no extra in a tin like they've given me in the past...hmm). Overall, definitely will come back here again!
author: James R.

description: I finally tried super duper burger and it was pretty darn good! I loved it! I came here with a friend and it wasn't busy. I couldn't  thoroughly exam the menu because my friend was on a short lunch break so I ordered what was their combo of a small cheese burger and some sweet potato fries with ranch and a drink. There are some seats to sit in the main floor, but if you go down the stairs of the shop there are more seats to sit especially if you come here in a large group. They have a condiment table both upstairs and downstairs so don't worry. Restroom is down stair. There is a huge T.V in the back so you can catch the game here and there are a few table games to play. Food was good and I really liked the sweet potato fries, but the price was kind of expensive. For a burger spot in the city that wasn't busy I really like this place and will definitely will come back. I highly recommend people who loves burgers to give this place a shot. The one by the metreon is super busy so do come to this location which is not as busy so you wait less.
author: Danika P.

description:
So happy they opened a location here. Staff is very friendly and lines move fast. There is a lot of seating downstairs. Just as good as I remembered when I had it a long time ago at the Chestnut location. 

Mini burger with a side of garlic fries. Bread isn't soggy, meat has good flavor, and unlimited pickles! Yummy!
author: Karen H.

description:
I used to love going to all the superdupers, but with its popularity comes a massive degradation of quality. 1) the old chicken buns used to be amazing, now they've been switched with chewy crud. 2) two of 3 times I ask for a regular bun, they screw it up. The clerks are just are in auto pilot 3) The moment I ask for a chicken sand.... they interrupt me and ask if I want cheese.  EVERY time!! Can you pls let me finish my sentence? The funny thing is that they then forget the cheese.  4) I once ordered a shake to go, yum. But they made it in a glass. When he realized his mistake he poured it to a plastic cup, but he left a bunch in the glass so I got about 2/3 full. $6 for a small shake. Ehh.  

Yes, these are small things.  But the experience used to be amazing, so the delta seems big.
author: Paul Z.

description:
Came here with my mom on a Friday morning and it was pretty busy. Had the mini breakfast combo with egg & cheese sandwich, a donut (choose from lemon, cinnamon, and chocolate), and a small coffee for $5. Bought an extra donut (75 cents) because how do you decide between sugary cinnamon goodness and chocolate at 10am?!

Everything was simple but delicious. Service at the counter was friendly and orders came out quickly.

Will definitely come back for the donuts (just the right size) and to try the lunch fare. Also, free fries for HH? That's my kind of place.
author: K Y.

description:
