Pretty much my favorite burgers ever. The patty is thick and juicy, perfectly cooked and seasoned, and they give you SO MANY toppings - make sure to add everything like jalapeño, pickles, etc! The garlic fries are to die for also.

My only complaint is that the place is packed every time I come here, so waiting in line always takes ~10mins + another 5 to wait for your food. The seating is actually pretty ample (for being right in the middle of the City) but since there are so many people we rarely find a place to sit. 

Friendly staff, fast service, and clean, modern interior. This is an awesome affordable lunch joint, always a reliable place to grab a quick bite!
author: Regan T.

description: Quick, fast and yum.  Good for a short lunch break with a nice burger n shake in the middle of the work day.  Their garlic fries is what I like the most.   Homemade pickles are very churchy.
author: Irene F.

description: This is my "Happy Place "  when I am needing satisfying comfort  food
author: Barry C.

description:
I don't know if it was because I was hungry or if it was REALLY THAT GOOD! Their burgers are high quality. My cousin and I shared a cheese burger and it was cooked to perfection. Amazing flavors which really complimented the grass fed beef. I wanted to dive into their menu but we were short on time and short on amount of space in our stomachs. 

I will be back for sure!
author: Max M.

description: Love their veggie burger. I always end up ordering the garlic fries and the fresh lemonade with brown sugar is all favorite.
author: Nayonika R.

description:
So I was out working in the city and the place I was at had a catered lunch but I wasn't really feelin it.  Quick yelp search and this place popped up and decided it had to happen.  So took a quick stroll down the street and I was there.  Menu is nice and simple so I didn't have to spend too much time standing around deciding what I wanted.  Went with the Super Duper Burger and the Garlic Fries just had to happen with it.  Luckily when I first got there there wasn't a line but in a matter of minutes there was a line of 10 people.  Food came out pretty fast and I took it back to the work location I was at.  

I gotta say the burger was excellent.  It was definitely juicy, the bun had absorbed some of the juice.  Eating it was sure messy but it was good.  Garlic fries were on point also.  This place hit the burger craving spot.
author: Scott T.

description: Nice consistent burgers. Love the garlic fries and shake. Friendly staff but my only complaint was I got it in lettuce and literally had a pool of butter! I've never seen such a huge butter pool in my life. I felt so disgusted I couldn't finish :(
author: Natalia G.

description: I just had to stop and try this place. From the outside it looks great and the name is just fun. I had a triple super duper burger (24oz) and a beer. It was outstanding. Beats five guys for sure and ranks up there with Burger Fi. Environment is great, music, beer selection small but good. Overall very good. Staff was surprisingly friendly and jovial. Might just be this location but they are down right funny. I'll be back here again soon.
author: Curt B.

description: Good place for a lunch time burger, garlic fries delicious.  Very clean good setrvice and friendly staff.  Plentny of seating enjoy a good burger with a friend
author: Anne K.

description: This place was very good! The mini burger is surprisingly big especially if you pay extra for the cheese, (.50) bacon, (1.00) and egg (1.50). It fills you up! For my wife and I, two of the burgers and fries came to 21.00 dollars.
author: Kaleb H.

description:
I have come here a handful of times and each time I found it to be, as Yelp puts it, "A-OK".  But today I definitely had a "meh I've experienced better" experience.  I still gave 3 stars as an average of my 4-5 trips, but today deserved 2 stars for sure.  Today I ordered from a very friendly and sweet associate, my receipt says 1:23.  I stood around and noticed that everybody seemed to be getting their food around me, even people who came after.  I am not a squeaky wheel typically, so I just continued to wait.  Finally, after 15 minutes, I asked somebody to check on the status and she returned and said, "it's coming right up".  That was not super helpful because I would have assumed that the status was always that it was "coming right up"...I mean...after I ordered was the status "maybe we'll do that later"? She was definitely trying to be helpful, so I just accepted the response and stepped back to keep on waiting.  5 more minutes went by and I decided to approach the counter and ask for a refund so that I could leave - I really needed to get back to work. Right as I did, my order came up.  I checked the time and it was 1:44.  21 minutes for a chicken sandwich and nothing on the side.  Just one chicken sandwich.  I wish I could say that the chicken sandwich was phenomenal and worth a third-hour wait, but it wasn't.  It was just OK.  

I can't say that I'll be rushing back to Super Duper on a lunch break.  The employees are all very friendly, but there should have been more communication with me regarding that wait.  If it is standard to wait 20 mins for their chicken sandwich, they should let you know that when you order.  Keep in mind that it was not busy at this time, there were 3 people in line ahead of me when I came in (I have been there when it was NUTS and got my food in less time). If there was a mistake or an oversight, they should have informed me of that and offered to either refund me or, they probably should have tossed some fries in my bag or something.  I didn't NOT order fries because I didn't want them ya know...I was trying to be good.  But if Super Duper had corroborated some fry-consumption for me, I might have been in enough of a greasy stupor to forget all about that 20 min wait :)
author: Emma H.

description:
Pretty nice place to talk and the food was great
It was a good serving size too. The environment was chill.
author: Terry L.

description: Great juicy burgers. Nice staff. Tasty homemade pickles.
author: C R.

description:
Meh, good, but not great.

A decent burger for the price.  Fries were average, nothing special.  Next time I might try the garlic fries.

Pickles were serve yourself from a jar next to the condiments, but wedge cut!  HTH do you put wedge cut pickles on a burger without having it fall apart on the first bite?  I guess you have to eat it like a sandwich, bite of burger, bite of pickle.  SMH.

Three stars is about right.  For comparison, Five Guy's and In n Out (none in the city unfortunately) are both better at what they do respectively than SDB.

Not quite super duper burger.  Perhaps, super ok burger would be a more apt name.

Trust me, there are better burgers to be had in SF (at all price ranges) than this chain.
author: I K.

description:
My third time trying SDB and each time, I'm always left feeling like I don't really care to return. The meat patty is reeeally greasy and the fries are nothing spectacular. Even the trio of dips was so-so. 
The staff at each location has been great, super friendly. Even when they're about to close in 15 minutes, they're ready to take our order. I like how there is seating upstairs and downstairs at this location.
author: Christine Y.

description: Similar to In-and-Out burgers, but with a few more selections such as chicken burgers. This location has a good amount of seating downstairs and also serves beer! Definitely a place to check out if you need some calories in you.
author: Leo M.

description:
This place has opened about a month ago or more but it's so good in the taste of the food and service. They serve breakfast until 10:30 am after that they'll give away the morning donuts awesome gesture. 

If you haven't already get the chicken sandwich with aioli dressing it is juicy, they're know for their burgers but the chicken is terrific. The people are nice and friendly, great place in the financial district on Kearney and Pine.
author: N A.

description: Constant good burger and good service. Almost face food pace but a very high quality tasting burger.  Try the pickles.
author: mike h.

description: I had only had a Super Duper burger once, a few years ago when visiting SF. Now that I live here, I'd been trying many of the other popular burgers around town. I finally made my way back to Super Duper and was disappointed. It wasn't bad, but it just wasn't anything special. At its price point, I think it's fine when you need a burger fix but there are so many more delicious options around in SF that you should probably seek out something else.
author: David B.

description: The service was warm and friendly, burgers are so delicious,and the strawberry shake is a must!! Great for families!!
author: Tonya G.

description: I'm always on the search for a great veggie burger, and I was pleasantly surprised by the one at Super Duper Burgers. I enjoyed the hummus on the burger - something I was a little unsure about before ordering. The staff was also very friendly and were happy to talk me through their items. It's a good price for a high quality burger, I'll definitely be back!
author: Panchami B.

description:
Good spot right next to my neighborhood :) 

Love being there and good ! The only thing is , they close at 10p which is a lil bit early :( 

But super duper is good. Its good to be fat , but do not miss this burger place :)
author: Jay M.

description: This place saved our night. The city was packed, we were wandering around San Francisco and we found a Super Duper Burger. The food was awesome and the service was outstanding!
author: Billie C.

description: This place is AMAZING! I own a burger spot and this place blew my mind. The service the beef, Fries ect!!!
author: Codi B.

description: Really good for a chain. Can't go wrong here if you are looking for a great burger at a good price.....especially in SF.
author: JC B.

description: Amazing burger and shakes! Right on Market so very convenient. Helpful staff. Cleanliness could be improved. Restrooms clean also which, to me, is a sign of the cleanliness of the entire restaurant.
author: Christy D.

description:
Damn it, I wanted to hate this place so much. It screams pretentiousness right from the moment you walk into it. Hell, the name alone made me want to punch it right in the face. 

But the food won me over. 

I really wish I had tried a burger. But I had beef the previous week, so I went with the chicken. The thing I liked the most about it is that you got multiple chicken patties on your burger. Unlike that ridiculous Smash Burger which gives you only one, limp smashed patty, this place gives you multiple. Which was much needed. 

Plus it has a pickle bar? How cool is that. 

The fries were good. Not exceptional. 

The vibe is cool. You might feel like you need to have a twisty mustache in order to fit in, but the food does make up for it.
author: Adam R.

description:
I was having a bad day when I walked in to Super Duper. A really bad day. The positive energy from the friendly smiling staff made my mood do a 180 from grump butt to smiling sally. And that was before I ate the food! 

Totally coming back. Thank you guys!!!
author: Amy P.

description:
This place was really good, the burger was great, their jalapeños had the perfect kick, their portobellos were beautiful & the humus was a good touch. The service was also very helpful, the cashier was dope young fella w a hip mustache, the stache was border line pedo but the guy pulls it off and it goes from pedo to beautiful. OH & the milkshake tasted like sex inside of clouds on a summers day. The size of the burger was kind of small but I'm not mad at it. The only reason I didn't give this place 4 stars, like it deserves, is because there was no BBQ sauce & thats almost a deal breaker for me :(


Update I went downstairs & they have a foosball table, jenga & a big connect 4. FOUR STARS FOR SURE.
Five if they had BBQ sauce lol
author: Luis B.

description: Garlic fries were amazeballs! The super duper burger was good but was not impressive and memorable enough. They do offer an Interesting drink selection. Clean place with good service!
author: Nin A.

description: Love there lemonade made with brown sugar, garlic fries are bomb. They have homemade pickles and I had there protein style double bacon cheeseburger! Everything was so flavorful and delicious will be coming back again!!!
author: Korina K.

description:
I've been here a few times and the Chicken Sandwich I get is definitely something to drool about. The servers are extremely nice, and food comes fairly quickly. It's pretty busy at dinner time so it's hard to find seating but would recommend for a quick lunch. Most enjoyable when they're fresh !

Wasn't too pleased with a the soft serve cone; I guess it's alright since it's not really a dessert place.
author: Adi P.

description:
These burgers sure are super duper! Pricewise, tastewise...just the perfect amount of goodness, and so close to work! Good and bad. haha. Reasonably priced, considering what else you can get for $8 in the vicinity. I spend at least $14 on a salad sometimes...damn that addiction. Anywho, ample seating! Definitely one of my go tos when the burger craving strikes, or even the ice cream cravings...or garlic fries cravings... :P. 

I have also tried the breakfast sandwiches here. Surprisingly, even the simple egg and cheese sandwich had just the right amount of seasoning and was flavorful! 

Typically though, I like getting the mini cheeseburger with caramelized onions, and everything else.. And when I'm feeling extra indulgent, I add bacon or a fried egg. Crispy bacon ftw. Those house made pickles are awesome as well. Nom nom nom.

The service here from what I've experienced has been great! They're nice enough to ask if you've been there before so they can say welcome back! It's a nice touch. 

I will see you again soon, when my cravings/drunchies strike. Super Duper to the rescue! :D
author: Mariel A.

description: Came here, was recommended by the locals and was not disappointed.  If you want a good burger and beer this is the place. Home made pickles were delicious!!
author: Danielle W.

description: I might make it a daily habit to get their breakfast deal which includes a breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese and add bacon, plus you get a doughnut and a small coffee for about $6.50.  And they are friendly and smiling, which is always so nice, especially in the morning.
author: Maile N.

description: Great food for a great price.  From order time to pick up time, there was a short wait time.  The food tastes excellent but was a little in the greasy side.  The garlic fries were excellent.  They serve wine and beer and have specials when ordering beers and burgers.
author: Eric A.

description: When I came to the Kearny location rather than my usual Market location, I was underwhelmed. The burger lacked in flavor and I didn't receive a slice of tomato. The meat fell apart and was on the dry side. However, the garlic fries rocked my world as they do every time. There was a lot of seating and was not overly crowded when I came with a friend at around 2:15 and found a place to eat really quick. The cashier taking my order was super friendly and made me feel comfortable and excited for my food. Would return purely for the fries and customer service.
author: Catherine L.

description: This is solely for their soft serve ! Love it ! Plus they allow you to buy child size if you're an adult with a smaller appetite ! Soft creamy and not too sweet ! Perfect !
author: Millie t.

description:
I spoke with a manager, and he was very helpful and understanding. He provided me with a gift certificate to compensate for the mistakes that had been made and assured me they are working on ironing out the wrinkles. He did not try to make excuses. I truly appreciated them taking the time to address this. So many places don't.
My experience was much better this time and the food was again GREAT. 
I am willing to bet they will be worthy of a  5 star review in no time.
author: Adrienne G.

description: This is the best burger, cooked perfectly, not too raw, not burned or over done. They offer a mini burger which isn't really mini. It's a regular-sized burger and it's delicious. Their fries and garlic fries are also outstanding, as well as their shakes. I sometimes feel guilty or disappointed after having a burger, but not when I eat it at Super Duper Burgers. I feel good about it. I treat myself once a month or so to a mini burger at the Kearny St. location.
author: Michelle V.

description:
I manage a small business nearby, just around the corner in fact and I was THRILLED when I read about your new location, mostly so I would no longer have to make the trek to Market street. We love the food and were regulars long before Kearney opened. If I was to guess, i would say we have ordered from the new location maybe 10 to 20 times since you have opened. In that time, I would say less than 25% of the orders have been correct. The staff consistently get our order wrong, and are generally unapologetic about it. Even when I give up and order a burger with everything on it, no customization, they get it wrong.

I think from now on if we have the Super Duper itch we will be going Market street, which is sad because Kearny is literally around the corner. I hope you guys figure out how to fix whatever the problem is there. It is doing a terrible sad disservice to Adriano Paganini's reputation. Pathetic.
author: Myles K.

description: Was in town for a conference thought I stop in and grab a bite to it ! Was so impressed with their food ! Everything is organic and so good. I was in town for a week and probably ate here 3 or 4 times. I got the mini cheese burger meal it was more then enough for me. I also tried the Oreo malt and chocolate chip cookies. Everything was so good and you can taste how fresh it is. So sad they don't have them in so cal. When I'm in town next time heading straight here!
author: Veronica E.

description:
I work in the FiDi and I was sad to see El Faro on Kearny close their doors (so shoot me).  When I heard that a Super Duper Burgers was opening in their place, I could hardly believe it.  Tasty burgers a block from my office?? -Naah.  It'll always be crowded.  To my delight, it is quite accessible most of the time, and they're efficient enough that they handle long lines of customers well.  

I'm easy.  99% of the time I get a burger--usually the mini, which is just a burger with one patty--and sometimes fries.  They're both done perfectly to my tastes, and it's a cheap meal.  The staff works their collective butt off, and is pleasant as well.

I tried their chicken sandwich once.  Didn't care for it.  My issue; clearly, others enjoy it.  That's fine.  As long as you save me a burger or two, I am a happy broad.
author: Earline A.

description:
Down under.

Five prior Super Duper adventures: http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw&q=Super+Duper

Star rating has increased over time. Might be because a $7 veggie burger with hummus and grilled onions has become an even better deal over time.

This new location does it just as delicious. Plus there is cool downstairs seating with exposed brick and a retro soundtrack: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XfR9iY5y94s

Trend is up.
author: Jason B.

description: Unbelievable burger!! SO...YUM!! Shake was also amazing!! Fries were ok...best with the dipping sauce! I'd go back for sure..
author: Adam H.

description:
Came here for breakfast. Got the egg sandwich and a cup of "fresh organic orange juice".

It tasted rotten like orange juice gone bad, and when I returned it after taking a sip, they proceeded to tell me I was wrong because the orange juice is freshly made everyday and therefore must have no problems. 

Well guess what? An hour later I had FOOD POISONING.

And I don't even have a sensitive stomach. 

I am never coming back again.
author: Mel P.

description: Incredibly friendly staff and great food!  They had tasty donuts left over from this morning which they were offering to dinner guests for free!
author: Michael A.

description: Soft opened today. big lines but still a quality product. I love this chain.
author: Amy W.

description: Passed this place a few weekends ago as they were having a soft opening. We were on our way to Chinese food so we didn't stop but came back Saturday to try it out. Pretty solid burger joint. Food was made to order so seemed hot and fresh. I had the mini burger with cheese and onions...cooked well and delicious. Boyfriend had the Chicken burger with chipotle sauce. It was happy hour all day Saturday so free fries with the purchase of a beer. Garlic fries are a must try. Although a little soggy from all the garlic and cheese, amazing flavor. Not very crowded around 1-2pm on a Saturday but imagine the place is hopping during the week.
author: Courtney O.

description: Bought a kid size swirl shake to go. It's not a taxable item. They charged tax.
author: Wendy L.

description: Staff is always friendly and helpful.  I usually get the super salad with burger patty. Love it!
author: Kia H.

description: If I had the choice between this place and eating my own poop. I'd for sure consider my poop. The fries are gross. The burger is greasy. And for 13 bucks it's not worth it.
author: Dallas P.

description: Amazing burger place, great burgers and fries. Had a mini burger with garlic fries and spiked shake. It's a little expensive but I feel the quality of the food matches. Had great service and the restaurant was clean and had a nice atmosphere.
author: Joseph N.

description: We only sampled the ice cream. The chocolate dipped organic ice cream cone was really good. The vanilla has more of a French vanilla taste. Was still good but worth mentioning. The chocolate soft serve ice cream was also really good. Friendly staff and clean tables. Worth a stop if you want some organic soft serve.
author: Paul L.

description: Super Duper is normally delish. I went for a mid-morning snack and ordered 1 breakfast sando with avocado and no cheese. We went over the order 2 times verbally. I waited 15 min (there were maybe 4 other people in there), and got a breakfast sandwich with cheese and no avocado. Unfortunately I was already back at the office when I opened the bag. Pretty bad.
author: Matheson J.

description:
We are from out of town and had our first Super Duper Burger three years ago while visiting San Francisco. We have been craving it ever since! 

It was our first stop yesterday and it did not disappoint. The ingredients are so fresh and top quality. Everything, even down to the lettuce was amazingly fresh and delicious. Make sure you spend the extra money for the garlic fries. Yum!

The line was pretty long but went quick and we only waited a short time for our food to be made.

I will say, we had a bit of trouble finding the place as there isn't a whole lot of signage in the storefront. But understand we are out-of-towners and this location is new so that may all change in due course.

Take it from someone who doesn't have the option of Super Duper whenever she wants, eat here as much as possible! Super yummy!
author: Rachel F.

description: What can I say about Super Duper? They're the best burgers in town, in my humble opinion. Hearty, juicy, fresh burgers on freshly baked buns. They're so good that I even love their veggie burger option-- comes with a nice schmear of hummus. Fries are on point. If you're feeling ambitious, try one of their delicious shakes. You can upgrade to a malt for an upcharge, but I'd recommend saving your money. In my experience, it's the same thing as a shake but with a sprinkling of malt powder on top. Still, you can never go wrong with Super Duper. The name says it all.
author: Teresa G.

description: AMAZING FOOD!!!!!!! Burgers melt in your mouth and are so delicious. Highly recommended.
author: Megan S.

description: BEST BURGERS EVER. It will definitely be the first place we stop the next time that we are in San Francisco. Donuts that out do all other donuts in the morning and the most incredible burgers the rest of the day. The garlic fries did not disappoint, especially with ketchup.
author: Anna S.

description: This is a great choice for an old fashion burger, fries and/or shake. The food is great, but this location is lacking in service and cleanliness. It wasn't always this way, but I haven't been there in a while see all new workers. I ordered a shake (repeated it twice) and the cashier rung it up as a cone for some reason and that's because he wasn't listening. So, I saw someone commence to fix the cone and I was able to catch them to let them know that I had ordered a shake. The worker then dumped the soft serve back into the machine, tossed the cone in the trash and began fixing my shake. In hindsight, I should have just taken the cone and been on my merry way.
author: Alethea Y.

description: I have loved Super Duper since it arrived to San Francisco. Now that the Kearny location is open by my work, I get to eat it more often! Yay! This location typically has shorter lines and the food comes out faster. I have nothing against the Market Street location but it is Market after all so the line can be too much for me. And the last two times I've gone, they've given me free donuts. THANK YOU!
author: Dana W.

description: After my friend's advice I had lunch at Super Duper.  The cashiers are very friendly. Mini combo menu was enough for me. Taste was not like "woooow" but it wasn't bad. At least it's worth trying
author: Ibo K.

description: Long story short, I recently quit my job because it's not exactly the right fit for me, so to cheer me up, my bro took me to this Super Duper Burger location. I have been to another location in the Marina with my s.o. and we didn't like it much, but I didn't want to say no to free food. Especially when your bro never buys you anything and then all of a sudden decides to be super nice! The burger was actually pretty darn good! And those garlic fries...just amazing!
author: Missy X.

description: The service was amazing and the food was delicious. Staff walked around and checked on how we were doing and were very helpful. I love Super Duper Burger and this is my favorite location!
author: Darius K.

description:
Went in on a Saturday to try the new location.

Since there were not a lot of people inside, the Chef could take his time to cook the Burger properly.

I had the Super Duper with no Cheese and Caramelized Onions for $7.75.

Though the bottom bun was pretty soaked with Grease, overall the flavor of the Burger was really really good.  Probably the best Super Duper I have had to date.

As always, I appreciated the free homemade pickles.

Super Duper is going to be a nice addition to the neighborhood.  I just hope everyone gets a Burger cooked and seasoned as well as I did.
author: Roy C.

description: Best burger I have had in the city! I have tried a lot of burgers in the Bay Area and this one takes the cake. The only other one that can compare is at Monterey peninsula country club but that's a 15 dollar burger and isn't a burger everyone can try. I will be back no doubt
author: Nicholas C.

description:
I was disappointed.  Visited Kearny location July 3rd, about 1:30PM.

The patty on the burger was thin, charred-crisp, and really really dry.   Reminds me of a re-heated burger.

The fries were stale and cold -- they must have been out on the shelf for a while, and whoever dispensed them was Super Duper Cheap -- the small container was just half full, and for the price they charge I'd expect better quality and quantity.

I've been to the Super Duper on Market/3rd and it was MUCH MUCH better - night & day.

Probably will avoid the one on Kearny.
author: Larry C.

description: Super delicious burgers! If you are craving a burger this us the place to come to. Tips for choosing the burger size. I chose the super burger (2 patties) thinking the mini wasn't going to be enough (for a female with a good appetite) but the super was more than i could eat. Great quality beefy juciness! The fries were pretty average. You wont be disappointed with the burger!
author: Anna B.

description: Got the garlic fries with a mini burger and it was delicious. The meat was cooked medium rare and it was juicy but my favorite was the garlic fries! Failed to mentioned that I also ordered a strawberry shake and it was ok, it needed more strawberries. All in all still enjoyed the meal and service was quick.
author: Jana A.

description: very yummy burgers. Garlic Fries and homemade pickles are amazing!
author: Kris T.

description: Amazing little breakfast sandwiches. The young lady at the front desk is so sweet & courteous, even so early in the morning! :) Killin it.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Pretty good burgers. I like that they're cooked medium because they stay juicy. The only thing I'd like is if the egg, if you choose to add one, would be cooked over medium, because the yolk oozes out of the burger.
author: Jessica W.

description: First, cleanest restroom of all time. 10/10. Second, the cashier surprised me with free fries when I bought a beer. $5 beers were already pretty good as a pregame drink for the restaurant next door, but this free fries business was just too much. Seating is very ample as there is a upstairs and downstairs section. Free refulls on soda, reasonable prices, just an overall chill place to relax and grab a bite to eat!
author: Bowen L.

description:
Maybe it was just pre-opening day, but this was the best Super Duper Burger meal I've ever had!

My Super Duper @ Market Street review = 4 stars
This one = 4.8 stars!

Quality -
 ***** The fries.  the fries!  Today's cook made perfect fries!  Probably in the top 5 places I've ever had fries- and I even eat fries at $$$ places.
 ***** The buns were toasty!  They were perfect!  Most of the time it's not toasted enough
 ****  The meat is the same across all Super Dupers.  This cook knows how to make the elusive crispiness to the burger without burning it, too!  The preparation outshines the meat quality.

Service - 
***** The guys behind the counter were friendly, fast, so nice!  My order was screwed up and they went over the top to correct it.
****    The manager, eh, was so so.  I thought he was nice at first - he's great at promotion, being friendly and operations stuff,, but when my order was screwed up, he wasn't very helpful.  Luckily, he hired the best guys behind the counter and I'm so glad my order was corrected - so tasty!
***** The music was loud upstairs (note, this is still before their official opening day), and the lady was quick to adjust it.

Location -
***** How cute it is on the INSIDE!  Try the indoor sitting - it's really layed out well.  The upstairs looks upon the cute Belden Place!
author: Cathy U.

description: This restaurant is VERY clean, friendly and a good value. Water in a real glass, homemade pickles, great fries and veggie burgers with all the extras!! The staff was helpful for a first time customer. The bathrooms are exceptionally clean for San Francisco! I will return.
author: Ashley H.

description: Amazing burger.  Great staff, very welcoming.  Good food!  Definitely will return the next time we're in town.  Had never heard of the place & just found out there are several in town.
author: Nicki W.

description: Stepped into this Super Duper on a very impromptu basis for a co-worker's bday. We were looking for a quick snack and some beer. We stumbled in only to be greeted by my new bestie, Victor, the manager. Not only did they have Racer 5 and Scrimshaw on tap, but purchasing a pitcher came with a free order of fries, and Victor even threw in a few "off-menu" burgers for us to chow down on. As we enjoyed their downstairs "party room", equipped with a Jenga set for each table and foosball, Victor came down with three ice cream sundaes on-the-house so we could sing Happy Birthday to my co-worker. What was just a 10 minute stop for a burger turned into a real event! Thanks, Victor, you are THE MAN! We will definitely be back for lunch, dinner, and future fast-food ragers to come!
author: joe t.

description: If you're looking for a fresh, tasty burger, you won't leave here disappointed. I walked here on my lunch break and was so satisfied. Normally after I eat a hamburger, I feel bloated and stuffed. When I was done grubbin on this yummy burger, I felt nice and full NOT bloated. You can totally feel the difference in meat quality here. I did pay $15 after customizing my burger. It was worth it. This is definitely a place i'll come to again when I treat my tummy to something nice. 2 thumbs up!!
author: T A.

description: Veggie burger here is absolute crap. The patty is dry on the outside and oily/soggy on the inside probably because it was frozen and fried. Either way - disgusting. My fries were cold so I went back and they gave me a fresh order. If you're looking for a good veggie burger - skip this place.
author: Marina K.

description: This may be subject to review, but I called during non-peak business hours to ask a happy hour question, and did even have the opportunity to leave a voicemail. I had a simple question about happy hour as i'm in charge of a large group, and couldn't even get my question answered. SAD!
author: Sam H.

description:
This is like my favorite location I knew when they were opening and it was all new. Not staying open as late as the other location or two but you know what they even had this special chef made burgers event thing... Just fail. Because of the staff. The location manager was really nice, or whoever seemed to be holding themselves actually accountable of something. The rest are quite gossipy childish and professionally irresponsible. My advice, since the reviews for Super Duper or "Super Duper Burgers" apparently are location specific is just lay some people off. It's not the location that should suffer. Or the company. This gmo and organic shakes/ice cream is a good thing. I have experienced snobbery or whatever it is however at other locations also. (Seems to be whenever I go to Metreon and Kearny locations...) And I am just not a difficult customer. Sorry, No. I am the easiest customer ever -- probably too easy. So if I'm at fault, then there you go.

I recommend double chocolate milkshake which is good even though the flat or old milk can spoil the ordinary chocolate one. Not to say even this hasn't been ruined, by oreos (what the hell) and I like oreos too but this move was intentional douchmeister, (or just you go see) or with a ridiculous price. I mean I thought it was a bit expensive, but then it keeps changing. Looking back at my collected receipts (on the go, memory is low) they end up seeming to charge me extra whenever they like at the time.
Garlic fries are always good if not healthy, even though this one adds unnecessary extra cheese which is un optional since it is made the same with the actual garlic, somehow you keep wanting to come back for more. I even had an extra dollar of change stolen from me which I went back for, due to some ridiculous "you walked in therefore I don't like you" mentality which can only be described as petty as jealousy.

I love Super Duper. I recommend any place with reasonable food and health standards such as they provide (I notice Chipotle.) They seem to be so busy they just hire whoever, and though I like their flyer -- "looking for superstars" they seem to offer whoever thinks they're awesome rather than who actually fits the people type of customer service, and courtesy. I am not looking for anything extra special when it comes to service. Just don't be such a dick. Three stars for petulant staff being Super douchey.

Ps cheese on garlic fries should be optional. Maybe even a bit less charge. Chocolate shake might be less especially if staff are dicks. I am afraid of going in next time and getting spit.
author: M R.

description: This is probably my favorite Super Duper. I've tried their burgers, chicken sandwiches(?), garlic fries, strawberry smoothies and few other things- I've always enjoyed it. Overall the food is simply great, it truly doesn't disappoint.
author: Linda O.

description: Armand just saved my life! (by helping me out) People like him keep the world smiling. Thanks again my good man!
author: Danny R.

description: Wow and yum! Fresh ingredients and beef tasted great. Speedy delivery and friendly staff. Garlic fries were great too!
author: Gabi B.

description: This location is right down the street from my office and it is quickly becoming a team favorite. Not only is the food of superior quality, (locally sourced, grassfed, etc.), the customer service is second to none. Michael and Victor even sent us back with some extra food for the office! HIGHLY recommended.
author: Blake M.

description:
I've been here three times in less than 2 months now, so this place has quickly become a place I know I can get a quality burger for cheap (SF-wise). 

I always get the mini-burger which is more than enough meat for me ($5.50, +50 cents for cheese). It comes with all the normal fixings + their tasty "super sauce", and you can also add jalapeños or grilled onions for free. 

Service is efficient and friendly, and there are also free pickles to be had (as much as you want). The last time I went, they tasted a bit old, but typically they've been perfectly juicy and crunchy. 

The garlic fries are DIVINE and a must-try imo. they're on the strong side (not really date fare), but if you're a garlic fan (as I am), they are worth the upgrade from normal fries. 

Also, Every Monday to Friday, they have a free fries with wine/beer purchase deal - essentially, you're paying around $2 for a quality draft beer (they have one wheat beer, one Pilsner, and one IPA, for all tastes). 

Super duper is not going to be the best burger you'll ever have, but for under $10 this is a fast, good quality meal.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Hands down the friendliest and best customer service I've ever experienced at a fast food restaurant. Can't beat the breakfast deal either.
author: Jared A.

description:
Going to this burger place was a reward for me after a hard week of classes, and nothing spells out reward like a greasy hamburger at my side with good old American fries at my side. I refuse to call them French Fries because those butt-holes wanna claim everything from kissing to toast... those conceited jerks need to get an Attitude Adjustment from a real Marine......
And his name is John Cena!!!!!! I notified the business employees to call their fries American and they said they'll take it under consideration.. Props to change!!
This place is a representation of what makes America great, It has three floors. A basement, the main floor and the top floor. The top floor is the best floor to go to. It provides Americans a chance to sit toward the window and look down on Greedy Italians drinking their 30$ Martinis, talking loud and obnoxiously like some Rich Bitch San Franciscan Asshole. Much like their horrible body odor their attitude stinks and they should be locked up in the zoo getting mauled by a Russian Bear. Other than looking down on Smelly Italian Americans that don't even speak Italian, Super Dupers has a Foosball table that will have you saying 
" OH SNAP!, THIS PLACE BE SUPER DUPER #LOL"
In terms of food this is where I become a negative Nancy, The food is good but it also carries an excessive amount of calories due to the Hamburger being greasy and the patriot fries being too salty. Don't get me wrong the food is good , just not good for your health.
author: Michael J.

description: Love Super Duper on Kearny St. Service is on point efficient and the quality is super duper.  The GM, Mike is kind and professional and goes beyond the expected customer service. Gave me a couple extra special breakfast sandwiches for a coworker that can't have cheese. She was pleased.  Catered a 150 plus breakfast to be served at 9: 30 am, everything was ready and I arrived 10 minutes early. Food still hot.  Made me look good at my firm. Will  be using working with Super Duper and Mike  again. He never takes credit. He is always giving credit to his team.
author: Olga K.

description: I tried a veggie burger and garlic fries. Burger tastes pretty good but it was small and a bit greasy and the sauces were blend. :(
author: Ashlie B.

description: solid burgers. I'm more of a fan of the garlic fries and milkshakes.
author: Raj E.

description:
Yes, I'm so happy that there's a Super Duper Burger just a block away from my office that serves breakfast. Actually, wait, this could be a blessing or a curse. I'm going to be walking past this store front every morning...uh oh. 

I think it's luck that I walk past this spot everyday in the morning to get to the office because I got to try out their mini breakfast combo on Thursday (5/28), during the first day of their soft opening. I was walking and I heard "Want to try a free breakfast?" Um, yeah, I'd love to! I got the egg sandwich and didn't know I could ask for ham or bacon, so it only had cheese and chipotle mayo. I had a choice of orange juice or coffee and went with coffee since they brew Four Barrel here (I love their coffee). They handed me a buzzer that would vibrate when my order was up. There was someone outside ushering people inside to try out their breakfast, so the place was pretty packed during soft opening, but the folks in the kitchen were cranking things out as quickly as they could. It took maybe 15 minutes total to get in and out. I walked back to my office to eat and noticed the donut was sweating bullets (oily), eek. The egg sandwich was delicious, however, with the chipotle mayo. Yum! My co-workers tried to go grab breakfast a little later and they had run out, but Super Duper gave them a coupon for a free ice cream cone with purchase of a burger.

The next morning (5/29), I walked past again and went inside for another round of free breakfast. By Friday, those who had gone the morning prior had told their colleagues, so it was busier even though I was there at the same time (around 8am). Oh well. I heard the person in front of me ask for bacon, so I did the same. Yum, bacon. The cashier that took my order had large coffee cups at his register, so I got a large coffee, woohoo! Oh the simple things that make me happy :)

Monday (6/1) was their grand opening, but I decided to take a break from Super Duper's breakfast. I came back on Tuesday though because, honestly, the $5 mini combo is a pretty darn good deal. Egg sandwich + donut + small coffee for just $5 ($5.44 with tax). It seems that they've gotten their donut process down because my donuts were fluffy on the inside and weren't oozing with oil. The mini breakfast combo only comes with one donut, but I got two in my bag! 

Good job guys! Keep up the great work, food quality,and service!
author: Katherine S.

description: The burgers are great. The policy to have only green waste is amazing. But I can't give them a 5 because they never get my order right!
author: Kokoe J.

description: Very friendly service, fun atmosphere, and great burgers. You have the option to add avocado and egg, which is just dandy.
author: Brian S.

description:
I love that they offer breakfast sandwiches and have a happy hour after work with free fries. BUT sometimes their quality control is poor. DON'T advertise hot fresh donuts in the morning and serve tepid soggy donuts that have been sitting too long next to each other in a pan.  I told them about it and they couldn't even offer me another donut because they were ALL lukewarm and soggy.  So disappointing, because if you get one when it just comes out of the fryer, they are really really good. 
The breakfast sandwich was good. Except they forgot to put the aioli on my sandwich, even when I said I wanted it. Oh well. I still give them 3 stars for a solid burger at lunch and good intentions.
author: Priscilla C.

description: The service here is really good. Someone was distributing free sauce and fries samples. One of the people at the register if I would like water while I wait. They also said welcome back. Or maybe it's just that lady at the far left counter. Great stuff! Thanks.
author: Rosalie T.

description: Sometimes when you are wandering aimlessly through a city and trying to find the BART station you stumble across something wonderful- a burger/breakfast sandwich joint that also makes delicious mini glazed doughnuts and offers gourmet coffee.  For $5 you get an egg and cheese sandwich, a small Four Barrel Coffee (that you can refill) and your choice of a glazed doughnut.   Service was quick and the food was tasty.  The mini breakfast was more than enough!
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: I can't tell you how much I love the burgers, fries and pickles at Super Duper. While I think there's definitely better ones in the city, this is up there in my top 5. They've never failed to produce an amazing veggie burger with any toppings I want (that they have available), the fries are extra crispy and salted just right, and the all you can eat free pickles they have in the self-serve jar are tangy, a tad spicy, and a perfect addition to your meal.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Omg! So glad and lucky I found this spot! Fricken ridiculously good! Only complaint is there aren't more of them!!!!!
author: Jonathan R.

description: Uh-oh... now there's one near work!!! Got some breakfast sandos for me and my colleague. Egg, avocado, bacon/sausage. What's not to love?
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I am in  SF on business from Dallas this week.  I wanted something simple/fast for dinner last night and I had read great reviews on here about this place.  It is relatively close to where I am staying (Union Square), so I thought I'd give it a shot.
I liked the atmosphere of the place.  The service was great.  I actually walked here in the rain last night, and the girl behind the counter immediately offered me and my co-worker towels to dry off with.  I ordered the Super Burger with cheese, requesting it be cooked medium.  Unfortunately my burger was cooked well done.  It was actually crispy around the edges.  The bun was toasted, which I like, but again, a little too long.  It was also crispy around the edges.  Dry and crispy isn't what I look for in a burger.  I didn't even finish it.  I ordered their regular fries, which weren't anything special either.
Overall a pretty disappointing experience.  I did appreciate the great service, however, but at the end of day, we go to restaurants for the food first.
author: Brent G.

description: Very fast service! Friendly at the counter and helpful staff. Burgers and fries were somewhat greasy, but delicious. The only problem was that my friend and I couldn't find a table because most of them hadn't been cleared of dirty dishes. Still, a very good option in SF that's more casual and quick.
author: Gabi C.

description: After walking Chinatown, we were looking for a noodle joint to complete the experience.yelp led us next door to this place to a joint that only accepted cash. We were curious about the appearance of super duper burger and walked over and boy were we glad we did! All the ingredients are organic, even down to the soft serve ice cream! All produce is organic and delivered daily! The general manager was super friendly and told us the only thing they freeze ate their French fries which definitely did not taste like it! Great experience overall and we didn't feel worthless after like we each pigged out on processed crap! Very clean and friendly atmosphere!try the garlic fries
author: Nick K.

description: AMAZING chain for burgers! The super sauce is truly amazing. Even though this is downtown and a popular spot for lunch during the busiest time of the day, the service was pretty quick and the order was made perfectly. Definitely recommend! Also, the veggie burger is on point.
author: Chandni J.

description: This review goes out to Michael and the Kearny crew!! I randomly stopped by with a colleague on Halloween and had casual conversation with Michael (the general manager) while taking my order. Being in the financial district, Michael knows he's against a rush of people but still finds the time to speak with every customer! I have felt this same welcoming atmosphere with all his employees every time I come to this location! In an effort to promote his business, he offered to give my firm of over 100+ employees FREE breakfast! On the day of preparation, he was able to accommodate us last minute! He even threw in some bacon (at a charge) when I ordered almost 100 slabs upon pick-up. I genuinely appreciate great customer service as it goes a long way. I've built a relationship with this restaurant and will be using their restaurants for future company events! Great job, Kearny crew!!
author: Monica G.

description: Got the chocolate milk shake which tasted bomb and smooth with chocolate chips that were a perfect size. They are gluten free friendly. The burgers can be lettuce wrapped instead. Highly recommend going if you like burgers with special sauce!
author: Victoria G.

description: Free burger for soft openning.  Grand openning on mo day June 1st.  Tasty burger and garlic fries are amazing
author: Danny C.

description: Top notch burgers with high quality ingredients. The burgers are really, really tasty. Friendly staff. This place is wholesome all around. We ate here on Thursday and the kids insisted on coming back on Saturday when we had to come back downtown to pick up some shopping goods. The youngest finally found a veggie burger she likes, and I can see why--moist and delish. Definitely a good spot for "new fast food" or a burger fix. I am eager to try their organic soft serve ice cream.
author: Tom C.

description: Very friendly staff and an above average burger. I also liked the location and the effort they put into making the downstairs seating into a nice area. I would go again.
author: Nicholas T.

description: Pretty good place for lunch when the line isn't too long, which happens a lot on Market. Garlic fries could be better, but overall the food hits the spot and gets the job done. A bit pricey for burgers, but considering how it's the financial district and tastes pretty freakin' good, it's worth it.
author: Ian L.

description: Best burger so far in San Francisco. I would advise you to choose the garlic + cheddar fries rather than the normal one. Much better and you get a bigger portion this way only a dollar extra. This is one of the places which are open at Sunday afternoon in the financial district, I haven't find a better place so far which are open at this time at this area.
author: Zoltan F.

description: I know what you're thinking. Sure, it's plausible that the burgers on offer in this business place are super, but are they super duper? This extra amount of duper is quite important, after all. This reviewer took a meal comprised of a mini burger with cheese and grilled onion, garlic fries, beer. Said garlic fries, given as a bonus due to this reviewer's beer purchase, were so garlicky it makes one's mouth numb. I find this to be suitable. When my attention turned to the burger component, one thing I noticed is this burger sandwich is the best looking specimen I've seen. It looked like the entry for "burger" in the encyclopedia. And the taste was exquisite. Interestingly, this burger does not scream an in-your-face flavor like some burgers. Rather, its quality sneaks up on you. Proof is: the last bite is as good, or better, than the first. On my travels here in "The City" I also took a meal at Split, which is similar (metal trays, burger, fries in box, organic), but I'd have to say this here establishment is better. So to conclude: My question is answered as yes. The super duper burger is, in fact, duper. A friendly server in the front tops off this experience, which is highly recommended by this reviewer.
author: Joseph K.

description: Great service and delicious food. Will be back to try more. Had the chicken sandwich today and had their donuts before as well. Best I ever had.
author: Tina K.

description: This review is past due. My coworkers and I went there for lunch the other day and my order got messed up. I specified to them that I wanted my burger to be well done but it came out "rare". I took it back to the person, Victor who I specified my burger to be well done, and I told him that it was the second time that SuperDuper made my hamburger "rare" when I specified well done. He apologized, immediately replaced it for me and etc. He handled it professionally and with great customer service and that is what I like about this place.  It is a great place to have lunch with great seating and friendly staff.
author: Anonymous B.

description: As far as burger places go, this one is pretty average. Their claim that their burgers are cooked medium is unfounded in my case as it came out well done and most of the juice came from the lettuce and tomato. Average fries, nothing spectacular. Homemade pickles were good, however. Decent value for what you get but not somewhere I'd go out of my way to visit again.
author: Chris M.

description: Pretty good burger, but never salty enough. And for the love of god, please learn to fry an egg. The egg white should not be clear. If you can get past these issues, you will enjoy the burger.
author: Winston L.

description: Got 3 cinnamon sugar donuts for breakfast this morning and part of each one was very hard - like hit is on the desk and hear a knocking noise hard. I'm not sure if they were over fried (they didn't look or taste burnt) or if they were old. Other than the disappointingly hard donuts, the service is great and the burgers are good.
author: Jennifer B.
